characters: O'DELL GIVES TOM BACK HIS RIFLE --
CHRIS RUNS TOWARD THE DESTRUCTION, DROPPING HIS CIGARETTE
WHERE COREY WAS SITTING IS VIRTUALLY NONEXISTENT. SHE DRO
PICTURES OF THE DARKO FAMILY ARE PUT BACK INTO THE PHILOS
-- AND STRIKES SAM RIGHT IN THE HEAD
STANDS FROZEN, HORRIFIED... IN UTTER SHOCK.
SHOPPING CARTS SWIRL IN A DECONSTRUCTING SPIRAL --
BILLY MOORCROFT IS GONE. THE FORCE FIELD IS GONE. COREY
WATER ERUPTS LIKE A GEYSER FROM THE PIPE WHERE THE HYDRAN
THE CHURCH REBUILDS ITSELF OUT OF FLAMES --
SAM'S BODY IS CRUMPLED IN THE STREET, MOTIONLESS...
SAM'S FACE DIPS BENEATH THE SURFACE OF RANDY'S POOL --
RUTH'S COCAINE FLIES OUT OF THE SWIRLING TOILET WATER --
FROM OUT OF NOWHERE AN OLD JALOPY SAILS RIGHT IN FRONT
SAM STANDS PEERING AT THE WRECKAGE... THE AREA OF THE CAR
AFRAID OF DYING' SCRAWLED ON IT --
THE BARS TO THE JAIL CELL STRAIGHTEN --
HIS DRAWING OF THE SWING SET STARTS TO DECONSTRUCT --
DUSTY STEPS BACKWARDS OUT OF THE POLICE CRUISER --
THE THREE CROSSES IN IMITATION OF CALVARY RIGHT THEMSELVE
COREY STEPS AWAY FROM THE KURT COBAIN POSTER WITH
THE JALOPY IS FLIPPED OVER ONTO ITS SIDE...
FATHER HOMEIJER PLACES BILLY MOORCROFT BACK IN HIS CAGE -
PILLS COME OUT OF BILLY'S MOUTH AND INTO HIS HAND --
I/E. BILLY MOORCROFT'S HOUSE, FRONT DOOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SAMANTHA DARKO (18) opens her eyes. She squints as the su sun shrinks her pupils to pinhole size. She sits up slowl looks around... and finds herself in midst of an endless wheat field.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam is pretty and demure. Her coppery hair flows past her shoulders. Disoriented, she stands and gazes at the infin golden shimmer. Amber waves of grain. Patches of forest i the distance. It's quiet. Serene. Beautiful...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She smiles, and starts walking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She emerges at the shoulder of a rural stretch of highway Arkansas. Adjacent to her position, on the other side of deserted lanes, is a TRUCK STOP.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amongst the TRACTOR-TRAILERS parked in the back lot is a white, late-80s model CHEVROLET CELEBRITY. Sam makes her across the asphalt toward the vehicle...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COREY RICHARDSON (18) is asleep, curled up in the recline driver's seat of the car. She awakens when Sam gets in on passenger side and slams the door shut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corey has the look of a typical rebellious teen: dyed hai piercings, a little grungy. She rubs the sleep from her e greeting the new day with something less than enthusiasm. finds a soft pack of CIGARETTES and lights one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What time is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Early...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corey adjusts her seat. She takes a long drag and chokes, then spits out the window. She starts the car...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corey's car cruises along the flat, open road. She cranks the VOLUME on the car's CASSETTE DECK, nodding her head t early-90s ALT. ROCK (suggestion: Into Dust, by Mazzy Star

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam looks out the window at the passing scenery: FARMERS work in the fields; a BILLBOARD advertising a local restaurant; ROADSIDE DITCHES filled with trash...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She fixates on a MINIVAN travelling in the slow lane. It contains the all-American NUCLEAR FAMILY: MOTHER, FATHER three SIBLINGS, one of them being a YOUNGSTER. The Youngs makes a face at Sam as they pass by...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corey glances at the CONTROL PANEL when she HEARS the eng start to RATTLE. She sees that the TEMPERATURE GAUGE has the red and her CHECK ENGINE LIGHT is on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By the time they pull over on the side of the empty highw steam billows out from under the hood. Sam gets out of th car to check on it while Corey remains behind the wheel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam peeks under the hood, trying to clear the air of the steam. It sounds like someone is rhythmically TAPPING the inside of the engine with a hammer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turn it off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (poking her head out the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turn off the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corey does so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doesn't look too good...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It smells funny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam looks up when she HEARS a PICK-UP TRUCK coming toward them. Corey watches as she steps out to wave it down...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pick-up pulls over ahead of them. CHRIS HOLT (24), a brawny, attractive young man, gets out. When Corey sees h she gets out too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks for stopping. Our car's messed up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My check engine light came on, then it just started smoking, and ticking and shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Chris pokes around under the hood, Sam and Corey excha looks. Chris pops opens the COOLANT CAP and burns his han the steam explosion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shaking it off) Blew your water pump. Can't drive it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: El Reno's just a couple miles up ahead. Can call for a tow there. C'mon, I'll give you a lift.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All three crammed into the cab of the pick-up, they drive through the center of El Reno, Oklahoma (population 16,00 and see some of the locals out and about [MUSIC MONTAGE fueled by early- to mid-90s era GRUNGE ROCK (suggestion: As You Are, by Nirvana) -- reminiscent of the `Middlesex Middle School Montage' in DONNIE DARKO]:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AGATHA DOWDY (54), an employee of the local DINER, sits o bench in front of the establishment smoking a cigarette. manager, TED MONCTON (50), calls her back inside...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RANDY EVANS (21), RUTH GIBBENS (18) and JEFF (21) and MIK JIMENEZ (20) loiter in the parking lot of a LIQUOR STORE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TRUDY POTTER (39) flirts with FATHER HOMEIJER (54), a Catholic priest, outside the BANK. A BANK SIGN shows the -- 12:00 PM -- then flashes to the DATE -- JUNE 18, 1995.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OFFICER RYAN O'DELL (31) has pulled over a PRETTY LADY an uses his uniform to impress more than intimidate...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They come up on VIETNAM TOM (48), who ambles along the si of the road against traffic, and he waves to them as they pass. He wears old, weather beaten clothes and a multi- colored SKI MASK over his head and face...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam swivels her head to watch Tom. ANOTHER CAR passes and waves to it as well. Chris picks up on her curiosity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He waves to everybody... Just kinda walks up and down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Resident nutcase?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People call him Vietnam Tom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was in the war?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He thinks he was... kind of a joke, ya know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam continues to stare until he disappears out of sight.. PAN DOWN to a PUDDLE by the side of the road. As a CAR TI splashes through it, PAN UP TO FIND:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dusty's auto repair shop, which is nothing more than a bi garage attached to his old two-story house. Corey's car h been towed there, and DUSTY GIBBENS (37; father of Ruth Gibbens), the lone mechanic, tinkers around under the hoo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam and Corey sit on the front steps of the house waiting bored as hell. A PIT BULL laps at a nameless treat wedged into a crack in the walkway. The girls are forced to get when Ruth (from outside the liquor store) comes to the do

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I get out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam and Corey move so that she can exit the house. Ruth's look is hardened, rough around the edges -- she appears o than her 18 years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The girls watch as she enters the garage to see her fathe She whispers something in his ear, and Dusty hands her so CASH, which she pockets then kisses him on the cheek. Aft this, Dusty wipes his hands on his greasy jeans and comes outside to address Corey and Sam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah... it's the water pump.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what do we do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can order you up a new one. Probably be a couple days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great. This the only show in town?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cheapest and the best. But you want me to call the tow guy back here, no problem. Probably charge you another hundred bucks, but he'll get ya wherever you wanna go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just go ahead and fix it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phil Coulter (48), the proprietor of a dingy little roads motel, looks up from a hardcover copy of Stephen King's GERALD'S GAME when the girls enter. They each have a SMAL SUITCASE and a BACKPACK in tow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What can I do for you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need a room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gets out a notebook and lays it out on the counter. Co finds a pen and starts to fill out a registration form... NEWS BULLETIN about the O.J. SIMPSON TRIAL plays at a LOW VOLUME on a TELEVISION in the b.g.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: $39 a night. How many you stayin'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just a couple, we hope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes the KEY to ROOM 15 off the rack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... welcome to El Reno.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam and Corey arrive at the liquor store, which is down t street from the motel. Ruth, Randy Evans, and Jeff and Mi Jimenez are loitering in the parking lot in a similar fas to how they were earlier in the day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You get checked into the motel alright?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy seems surprised that Ruth has already made their acquaintance. He wastes no time in introducing himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My name's Randy. This is Mike and Jeff. Guess you already know Ruth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Samantha.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They shake, and Corey seems at ease mingling with the strangers. Sam hangs back a little.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of you guys mind pickin' us up a bottle of something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I can manage that. What do you want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. Vodka, whiskey, whatever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corey looks to Sam, who produces some cash. Randy takes t money and heads for the store.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be right back...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After he's gone, there's an uncomfortable moment of silen in which Mike and Jeff ogle the girls mischievously. Ruth stares at them in a different way. She seems somewhat resentful of their presence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From Virginia, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw your plates...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corey and Sam both nod in mundane acknowledgment. Another beat of uncomfortable silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where to?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your obviously just passin' through here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're on the way to Vegas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ruth snickers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... you need anything besides booze, you just lemme know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy comes out of the store with a bottle in a brown bag passes it off to Corey, along with some change.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks a lot, man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No problem. You guys wanna come back to my place for bit? Bring your bottle, we got some weed...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corey looks like she's considering it, but --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm really tired.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She takes Sam's signal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I think we'll just head back. Been a long day, ya know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's cool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The clock on the BANK SIGN shows 3:30 AM -- then flashes JUNE 19, 1995... It changes again, this time to a countdo to the JULY 4TH FIREWORKS CELEBRATION: 15 DAYS, 17 HOURS, MINUTES, 57 SECONDS... 56 SECONDS... 55 SECONDS...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam awakens suddenly from a nightmare. She lies atop the blankets wearing a T-SHIRT and BOXER SHORTS. She looks ov and sees Corey passed out on the other full-size bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWO PLASTIC CUPS, EMPTY SODA CANS, and the BOTTLE are on nightstand between them, the liquor partially consumed. There's a digital CLOCK/RADIO that reads 3:30 AM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The TV is on, and a late night INFOMERCIAL for the GEORGE FOREMAN GRILL plays. Sam stares at the screen as the imag WARP and RIPPLE in a way that coincides with an increasin loud, rumbling TREMOR from outside...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a daze, she gets up and slowly walks closer to the television. She reaches out with her RIGHT HAND, about to touch it... A strange, abrupt HARD CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam is in a grassy field behind the motel, moving away fr the building. She wears a HOODED SWEATSHIRT, JEANS, and h RIGHT HAND is wrapped in some sort of MAKESHIFT BANDAGE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a GASH in the side of her forehead by her temple, with what looks to be a SHARD OF METAL partially embedded under the skin and protruding from the wound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She is without expression, and her movements are rhythmic fluid. A tall AERMOTOR WINDMILL towers in the distance...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A glimpse of the field through Sam's eyes shows a phosphorescent PLANE OF DESTINY -- an intricate grid in w objects organic and inorganic dwell in assigned positions and move according to a framework of set paths.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A JACKRABBIT follows a silvery VECTOR SPEAR like propheti life-gel to its burrow... COSMIC ENERGY burns around a CLUSTER OF STONES... Miniature VECTOR SPEARS lead a SWARM INSECTS around in a circle and then BUZZING right past Sa field of vision...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's infinitely complex, but Sam sees through it clearly. has no vector spear of her own to guide her, but she is cognizant of her path... She moves toward the WINDMILL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam appears at the foot of the windmill tower. A giant WA TANK squats beside it. Remaining stoic, she looks up and Vietnam Tom sitting atop the windmill platform, more than feet up, staring back down at her through the eyes holes his ski mask...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom peers over the edge of the small platform, the surfac which is littered with TATTERED CLOTHING, a WATER BOTTLE, CANS OF FOOD and SCRAPS OF A TARP. He cradles a RIFLE in arms...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His focus shifts from what is at the foot of the windmill what is sitting right beside him --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REVEAL Sam. Her legs dangle over the side of the platform and she stares off into distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sky's so beautiful here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom looks in the direction that she stares and then back her. Sam turns to meet his gaze...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But we can't stay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam sees through to the core of his physical being, the DYNAMIC CENTER of which lingers pulsating in a translucen circle around his chest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Magnified NEURONS in TOM'S BRAIN send ELECTRIC IMPULSES t release NEUROTRANSMITTERS, which excite OTHER NEURONS...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom slowly reaches out to touch Sam, but an invisible FOR FIELD makes contact impossible. RIPPLES swell throughout clear plasma-like barrier from where he touched it, and h hand remains glued to the spot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam extends her bandaged right hand, and presses it to Vietnam Tom's as if she were touching a mirrored image of herself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The contact generates more RIPPLES, and as TREMORS begin shake the windmill a DISTORTED VOICE echoes throughout th

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 15 days... 18 hours... 45 minutes... 6 seconds. That is when the world will end.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A CYLINDRICAL PORTAL opens up below them, gaping and swir like God's eye on the mouth of a liquid tornado. As Sam a Tom stand in unison to peer into it, a HEXAGONAL PLATE OF WHITE LIGHT emanates from within --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They appear near the foot of the windmill, sprinting away from it together. Tom has his rifle, and he looks up to t sky as he runs...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...there's a brilliant flash of GREEN LIGHT -- deafening THUNDER -- a blinding EXPLOSION --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam awakens to the morning sun blinding her. She struggle peer through the harsh whiteness at a looming figure that stands over her. Her eyes adjust to discover that it's a policeman -- Officer O'Dell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: `Fraid you can't sleep here, miss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam sits up and realizes she's on a bench at a bus stop n the side of the road. O'Dell's tone is innocuous, and whe she looks up at him again she sees that he's grinning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got anyplace to be?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam manages to find her voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The motel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She takes his hand and rises.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Dell's cruiser pulls into the motel parking lot, which uncharacteristically full. A FIRE TRUCK is parked by the of the road. Just then, a call comes in on the POLICE RAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We got some kinda situation at Frank Haley's farm...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Copy that. I'm here now...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where the towering windmill once stood is now only a CRAT about 5 feet deep and 10 feet in diameter, with charred b of wood and metal strewn everywhere. GROUND WATER spurts the broken WELL SEAL...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And a cantaloupe-sized METEORITE sits in the center of th crater.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two FIREMEN haul out the meteorite with gloved hands as S and O'Dell arrive on the scene. Corey is already there looking on, as well as Chris Holt, who gave them a ride i town, Phil Coulter from the motel, and other local CITIZE FRANK HALEY (54), the farmer who owns the land, is fuming

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Un-fuckin'-believable...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Firemen drop the porous, misshapen clod by his feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's still warm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know how much it's gonna cost me to replace this goddamn windmill?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Officer O'Dell steps up beside him and kicks the meteorit with his boot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sell this thing off to some meteorologist nerd club, I bet you could do okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ya think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam looks down at a CAN OF FOOD on the ground amidst some scorched CLOTHING. O'Dell takes note of some other CANNED GOODS and SCRAPS OF TARP.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's all that stuff, Frank?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That whack job Tom's been squattin' up there the last couple a' months. Thinks he's the goddamn town watchman... (BEAT) You think he got blown up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone scans the ground for signs of human remains unti Phil pipes up:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw him out in front of the motel early this morning, alive and well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (SARCASTIC) Oh, well, thank heavens...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam turns and peers up at the WATER TANK. It's marred by MARKS and DENTS from the explosion. As she tilts her head looks closer, she can almost pick out a shape created by damage -- a negative image like the Shroud of Turin...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...in the form of a bizarre, toothy-grinned FACE OF A GIA MONSTER BUNNY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam and Corey are on their way back to the motel room whe they turn and see that Chris has followed them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you guys stayed here last night?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of us did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam gives Corey a look. Chris decides to ignore the comme

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's up with your car?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's gonna take a couple days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For a water pump?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam and Corey shrug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: None of my business, but...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's distracted when a brand new `95 BMW pulls up and par nearby. JEREMY FRAME (25), a thin, pale young man hops ou and hustles into the field toward the crash site.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris regains his train of thought:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was just gonna say, if you wanted, I could give you a ride back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks right at Sam when he says this. He then glances at Corey, as if just remembering she was there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You too. I mean, I could give you both a ride.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To Middlesex, Virginia? Do you have any clue how far that is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (SHEEPISH) I got some time...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam looks as though she's about to say something but Core overpowers her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're not goin' back. Even El Reno's better than there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris makes eye contact with Sam again. She maintains it a moment and then looks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vietnam Tom explores a cluttered junkyard, gathering materials. He scours amongst the PILES OF REFUSE, RUSTY MACHINES and crumbling STORAGE SHACKS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He bends to pick up a SCRAP OF METAL and adds it to a collection he's making in a worn SATCHEL...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Sam and Corey are about to enter the diner, Trudy Pott a bank teller, is on her way out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The girls move to the side so she can exit, and take noti of a MISSING PERSONS SIGN posted next to the door -- BILL MOORCROFT'S (10) dark, empty eyes stare at them from the BLACK & WHITE PHOTOGRAPH.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isn't that just awful?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trudy has stopped and is looking over their shoulders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His poor mother...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The girls sit at a booth, sipping Cokes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much money do we have left?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not a whole lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't believe your fucking parents wouldn't give you anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They totally flipped out that I was even going. They weren't about to give me money for the big trip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We should've waited till the end of the month when my mom gets her check.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She wouldn't have given you anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know where she keeps her cash. What's she gonna do, send her boyfriend after me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corey pokes at the crushed ice in her glass with her stra

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doesn't matter. As soon as we get to Vegas, we'll be set. My cousin said sometimes she makes two grand in a week.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam is impressed, but something about her subdued reactio exhibits reservations... Just then, Agatha Dowdy arrives plates of BURGERS AND FRIES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here you go. Where'd you two say you were from again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Virginia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You hear that, Ted?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She calls to Ted Moncton, who is busy behind the counter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These girls are from Virginia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be damned. I'm from Reedville, if you know where abouts that is...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neither Sam nor Corey give much of a hint as to a yes or

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, have yourself some ice cream when you're done, on the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COREY                               SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.                           Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anything else you need, give a holler.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agatha moves off, and Sam and Corey start to dig into the food...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Momentarily, someone else enters and takes a seat at the counter by their booth. It's Jeremy Frame, the driver of BMW. He raises a finger to alert Ted of his presence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just a coffee, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted nods and pours him a cup... After he receives his cof Jeremy turns and stares at the girls. They both notice hi doing it, but Corey is the first to speak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can we help you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no... it's just that I recognize you. I saw you by the motel. Pretty amazing, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just made a deal with Frank Haley to buy it for seven-hundred fifty dollars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoop-dee-doo. What the hell are you gonna do with a friggin' meteor?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meteorite, actually...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corey rolls her eyes at being corrected. Sam smirks and munches on a french fry -- she's enjoying their conversat

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna study it. I'm a grad student at Redlands... we've actually got a pretty cool geology lab there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corey focuses on her lunch, ignoring him, but Jeremy goes

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've gotta do some tests, but if I had to guess, I'd say it's a siderite. They're composed primarily of iron and nickel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have fun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My name's Jeremy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's nice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam glances up at Jeremy, expecting him to be hurt or embarrassed by Corey's snub. But he's not. He's smiling a her, and she can't help but smile back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Each licking an ICE CREAM CONE, Corey and Sam walk past t home of Father Homeijer. The priest is outside working in flower garden, wearing his CLERICAL COLLAR. An old CATHOL CHURCH rests on the same lot as his house, looming behind

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When Father Homeijer sees the girls walking by, he rises his work, takes off his gloves and wipes sweat from his forehead. Sam and Corey both notice him eyeballing them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's his problem?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just keep walking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corey waves to him in a sarcastic, exaggerated manner... priest doesn't wave back, but continues to gawk at them u they go around the corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Freak...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vietnam Tom crouches in a decrepit SHACK covered by a pie of CORRUGATED ROOFING. He works with great focus, arrangi VARIOUS BITS OF METAL into some sort of small SCULPTURE..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Having finished their ice creams, the girls pass the liqu store on the way back to the motel. They find Randy, Ruth Jeff and Mike at their usual post.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, what's up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not much... just getting stared down by creepy priest boy back there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Father Homeijer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry, you're a little old for his taste.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, he's a fuckin' perv.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Randy) You got an extra cigarette?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy takes a pack from his pocket and offers her one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm throwin' a big party at my house tonight, you guys should come by. No excuses this time...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam and Corey look at each other, considering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're gonna be stuck in El Reno, you might as well have some fun, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The party at Randy's teems with LOCALS, ages ranging from early teens to late-20s. On the back deck is a KEG OF BEE and a BOOMBOX blasting MUSIC. There's a slimy-looking POO and a few people swim in the greenish water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy and Ruth make their rounds as a pair. They stop off Ruth can sell a BAG OF WEED to some eager KIDS. Corey and hang with Mike and Jeff, drinking beer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You guys gotta come visit the club when we get all set up. We'll give you the VIP treatment, man...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike and Jeff are both excited about this proposition.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounds good to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give us a little time, me and Sam'll be runnin' that place, no doubt... right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Definitely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corey is relaxed, enjoying their newfound friends, while appears more out of place. She drains the better part of cup for some liquid courage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy and Ruth converge back on the group just as Officer O'Dell creeps into the backyard wearing plainclothes. Rut notices him first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That pig, O'Dell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry about Ryan. He might be a cop, but he still likes to party.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy's theory is proven when O'Dell takes a FLASK from h pocket and has a snort before approaching a pair of TEENA GIRLS... But Ruth is still not satisfied.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think that asshole knows I deal. You know how fucked that is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From what I hear he's got a little somethin' goin' on the side himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fucking pig's a pig.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're all distracted when somebody does a cannonball in the pool and splashes them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MIKE                               JEFF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck!                            Bastard!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam bends to wipe some of the water from her pants. Ruth watches her, smirking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We might as well all go in now, we're already wet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good idea...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Without warning, Ruth shoves Sam backwards into the pool

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She sinks into the murky water in SLOW-MOTION. All SOUNDS DROWNED OUT and everything is tranquil, completely detach

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through her blurred vision, Sam can see Randy's PORCH LIG glimmering beyond the surface of the water... TRANSITION

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SPOT LIGHTS are blinding from the perspective of the STAGE. Through the WHITE BLUR an auditorium full of PEOPL can been seen...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In SLOW-MOTION and perfect synchronicity, YOUNG SAMANTHA and the "SPARKLE MOTION" GIRLS are in the midst of their dance performance... BACK TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A HAND reaches into the pool, grabs onto Sam's arm and pu her up --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She breaches the surface of the water, gasping for breath back to reality. She sees that Randy is the one responsib for pulling her out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You fall asleep down there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He, Ruth and the others are looking down at her, laughing Sam is lost in thought, struck by her vision...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She snaps out of it when she sees Corey tear off her top jump into the pool beside her. Many of the PARTYGOERS hoo approval, and Randy, Mike and Jeff strip down and leap in right behind her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam swims toward the far side of the pool where the steps are, and fewer people. When she arrives there, she's surprised to find Chris Holt waiting for her with a towel

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thought you could maybe use this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Chris hands her the towel, he notices a wide SCAR on t inside of Sam's RIGHT WRIST... but doesn't mention it. Sa wraps the towel around her sopping wet body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corey looks over and sees her getting out...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris and Sam stand by the keg with fresh beers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what's so wrong at home that you had to take off?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The question takes Sam by surprise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd love to get outta here someday too... just don't know quite where I'd go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam decides to open up a little.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hate it there. It's like everyone knows everything about me, but I'm invisible at the same time. It's like the worst of both worlds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Small towns. How `bout your family?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They didn't want me to leave... well, they did, but they wanted me to go away to Harvard or something like that, like my sister.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam takes a big sip of her beer, showing signs of tipsine

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sometimes I think it would've been easier if... I just, after my BROTHER-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam stops herself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (changing gears) That's why I love Corey, she just doesn't give a shit. She does what she wants and she doesn't care what people think.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You just gotta be yourself, that's all. What is it you wanna do exactly?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I always thought I'd be a dancer, like in a troupe or something...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam is self-conscious after admitting this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That sounds kinda stupid probably.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I was younger, my dance team was on Star Search.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah... but I didn't go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't end up dancing in the talent show where they got discovered... I didn't really feel like it at the time anyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But that's why we're going to Vegas. There's lots of opportunities there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris glances over to the pool where Corey is topless, splashing and goofing around with some BOYS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (SMIRKING) Yeah, good place for it. Gettin' some practice on the way, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam takes offense, getting drunk and sensitive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that supposed to be like some kind of judgement or something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I was just-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She takes her beer and storms away from him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam, wait... hey, come on...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam finds a STOOP at the side of the house where she can alone. She can HEAR the PARTY going on in the backyard, b no one else is in sight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still soaking wet, she plants herself on the stoop and st to pound the rest of her drink...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A strange, abrupt HARD CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam lies in the middle of the street in front of Randy's. lone, flickering STREET LIGHT intermittently bathes her i orange glow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She is completely dry, wearing her HOODED SWEATSHIRT and JEANS, with the MAKESHIFT BANDAGE wrapped around her righ hand. The SHARD OF METAL protrudes from the GASH in her forehead...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A CAR suddenly screams right past her prostrate form, mis her by inches. She sits up slowly and looks toward the fr of Randy's house, which is about 20 yards away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two DRUNK GUYS exit the house and enter the complex, phosphorescent grid that is Sam's field of vision. VECTOR SPEARS jut from their chests and precede all their moveme as they open the gas tank of a PARKED CAR, insert a SIPHO and begin to drain the gas into ANOTHER VEHICLE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hurry up...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Although she is close by, they take no notice of Sam whatsoever. ANOTHER CAR speeds by, again nearly crushing but she doesn't flinch...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stands, and turns deliberately to face the opposite s of the road where, unlike the Drunk Guys, there is someon who is completely focused on her -- Vietnam Tom crouches DITCH near a CULVERT --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam appears with him in the tenebrous ditch. Tom stares a her wide-eyed through the eyeholes of his ski mask.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From one end of the broad, open culvert they can see stra through to the other side...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A PORTAL starts to take shape within, swirling around the circumference. Soft, BLUE LIGHT touches their faces from phosphorescent glow, and a gust of WIND is nearly strong enough to make them falter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the opposite end of the culvert, a PLATE OF WHITE LIGH flashes for an instant then transforms into an image of

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom and Sam stand outside the church. The STEEPLE reigns them. Sam is stoic as she watches Tom climb the STONE STE and approach the great WOOD DOORS...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam sits like a statue in one of the PEWS. Tom strides pa her in a daze, moving toward the PULPIT...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beside the ALTAR stand THREE BARE CROSSES in imitation of Calvary, each standing over 4 feet tall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam looks up to a HIGH CORNER, above the pulpit to the ri where two walls and the ceiling meet...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The three planes come together at an irregular angle, wit the WALL ON THE RIGHT SIDE SLANTING INWARD, and the CEILI SLOPING SLIGHTLY DOWNWARD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PHOSPHORESCENCE burns in the three queerly pitches lines, with a concentration of heightened energy at the juncture

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A VECTOR SPEAR bulges from Vietnam Tom's chest where he stands below it, reaching higher and higher...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Tom's SPEAR gets closer to the convergence point, the BIZARRE ANGLING becomes more exaggerated because the plan start to DIP and SWELL with impossible elasticity --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam and Tom find themselves squeezed between the inner an outer walls. Claustrophobic, dusty and obscure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dilapidated WIRING snakes around them, and Tom barely has enough space to reach forth and touch it with his finger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COSMIC ENERGY jolts through the WIRE. A SPARK. A BLUE FLAME...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heat and pressure build. The old dry wood begins to CREAK SNAP -- FADE TO WHITE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SHARP SOUNDS echo and fade away... then become presen again. Louder now, and different. A BANGING...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam pulls back the CURTAIN OF WHITE -- a SHEET over her f She's lying on the floor of the motel room in between the beds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's alone, and naked except for the sheet. Her WET CLOT are in a heap beside her. Her head is throbbing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She scrambles to put something on so she can get the DOOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Having thrown on some wrinkled clothes, Sam opens the doo find Phil, the motel owner. He does not look pleased.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You plannin' on checkin' out today?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (GROGGY) Uh... I, I don't know yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, it's already way past checkout time, so you'd better figure it out quick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've just gotta find Corey... and check on the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You do whatever you have to, but if you're stayin' another night I wanna see some money up front.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam approaches the bank, and when she sees the tall SIGN the digital clock, she stops and stares up at it. It stri a chord but she doesn't know why...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sign reads 12:48 PM -- and then -- JUNE 20, 1995. It changes to the FIREWORKS COUNTDOWN: 14 DAYS, 8 HOURS, 11 MINUTES, 22 SECONDS... 21 SECONDS...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam enters the small bank, and as she approaches the coun she sees that Trudy Potter is in tears. Some of her FEMAL WORKERS are consoling her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't believe it... I still just don't believe it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's gonna be alright. You'll see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trudy looks up and sees Sam waiting uncomfortably.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dabbing at her eyes with a tissue) Can I help you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is everything okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it's not... Mount Calvary burned to the ground last night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mount Calvary?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Father Homeijer's church.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh... How did it happen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The police are looking into it, but... I know it was arson.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trudy leans in to talk quietly to Sam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's no secret to me how people in this town feel about Father Homeijer. The horrible accusations that have been made against him... But it's just a lot of nonsense. El Reno's changed so much since I was a kid growing up here. The young people nowadays... (BEAT) No offense.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She places her hand on top of Sam's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But with all the drugs and the crime... I just don't know what this world's coming to anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam tries to redirect her focus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you able to get money wired here from my bank back home?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't usually work with other banks like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need to check my balance and get my money out. How do I do that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll have to call and arrange it. You could always use Western Union. Where's your bank?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Virginia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh... `cause they're gonna need to have a signature.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Disappointed, Sam turns to leave...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As she's on her way out, she notices a BULLETIN BOARD wit another MISSING PERSONS SIGN for BILLY MOORCROFT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stands before the picture, staring into the young boy dark, empty eyes. Though it's just a low quality black &a white photo, Billy's face emotes profound hopelessness an despair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Sam comes out of the bank Jeremy rolls up in his BMW a parks in the lot. He gets out and approaches her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't get your name at the diner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Sam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeremy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They shake, and Jeremy holds her hand for a little longer than what is generally comfortable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what are you up to?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trying to get money... not very successfully.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've gotta pick up some cash too. Need some supplies for the lab. I don't think I've even slept since I got my hands on that meteorite. You should come by the lab with me and check it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam starts to walk away from him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I could let you borrow some money... if you need some.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't even know you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's okay. I trust you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks anyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're sure you don't want to check out the lab?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry... I've gotta find Corey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam turns to leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe some other time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corey rides shotgun in Randy's car, chewing on some greas FAST FOOD, looking quite content. Randy is behind the whe with a BEER in his hand, and Mike, Jeff and Ruth are pack into the back, passing around a JOINT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How many cheeseburgers did we get?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like eight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike passes the joint up to Corey and she takes a big hit chases it with some beer...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait, did we get smokes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone in the car is stunned into momentary silence whe they turn a corner and see what's left of the church.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MIKE                            RANDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa!                           Jesus Christ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: POLICE and FIREMEN swarm. Father Homeijer stands with Off O'Dell, gazing at the soggy ruins. The only things standi amid the charred mess are the THREE BARE CROSSES of Mount Calvary. But they aren't completely intact --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All three are bent drastically forward, sagging down towa the murky ground...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Musta' melted from the heat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Father Homeijer looks down at the metamorphosis, beside himself with bitterness and sorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're made of silver-plated steel. A simple fire couldn't do that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you sayin'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is an extension of Satan's own hand... I've seen it coming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rolling his eyes, O'Dell walks away, leaving the priest t grieve for his church in private.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vietnam Tom continues to toil over his SCULPTURE, but progress has been made...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It has begun to take on a recognizable form: a GROTESQUE COUNTENANCE with TWO LONG EARS, BULGING EYES and a devili TOOTHY GRIN...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam is walking in front of a DEPARTMENT STORE when Randy' car pulls up beside her. Corey sticks her head out the passenger side window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened to you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened to me...? Where the hell've you been?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I crashed at Randy's. We just got food. Want a burger?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My stomach's fucked up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JEFF                             MIKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Awww...                         Poor tummy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff and Mike taunt her from the back. Ruth leers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We gotta talk about what we're gonna do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry about it so much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The motel guy came to the room this morning all pissed off. We're probably not even gonna have enough money to pay for the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corey sighs, debating weather or not to get out. Before s can reach a decision, something in the department store's parking lot catches her eye: a LITTLE BOY with dark hair, wearing a BIRTHDAY HAT...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But she blinks and he's gone, having disappeared between parked vehicles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Confused, Corey rubs her eyes and gets out of the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Should I wait a minute?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We gotta get some smokes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just go ahead. I'll catch up with you later on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright. Later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corey gets out and shuts the door. Randy speeds off towar intersection about 20 yards ahead...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris is at work, stocking shelves inside the department store...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He checks his watch, stops what he's doing and grabs a PA OF CIGARETTES from his breast pocket -- time for a smoke break.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam and Corey meander toward the intersection where Randy car is stopped at a red light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We just gotta figure out what we're gonna do. I don't think-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ABRUPT) Lemme guess, you wanna go home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wanna run back to mommy and daddy and say sorry so they can put you through college. Well that's real big of you, Sam, but I don't have that option.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (taken aback) What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll go home and get the shit kicked out of me, and get my ass grabbed by my mom's boyfriend...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're almost to the light, which is still red, and comi up on Randy's car. Jeff, Mike and Ruth stare out at them the backseat, smelling the drama.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I knew you'd bail on me eventually, but not this quick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not bailing on you. Would you JUST-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can fucking sleepwalk back to Middlesex for all I care. I'm not driving you... you're a fucking drag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The light turns green, and Randy's car peels across the intersection, making a left...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you, Corey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam wheels on her and steps out into the street, storming straight across. Corey starts to follow... but something stops her in her tracks: BILLY MOORCROFT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stands on the opposite side of the intersection, in th trajectory that Sam is walking -- but Sam doesn't see him

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billy wears a BIRTHDAY HAT, SLACKS and COLLARED SHIRT. He looks pale and weak, and is covered with BRUISES. He star right back at Corey, as transfixed as she is... TIME SLOW DOWN. [Note: Sam's position is in the middle of the road. Randy's car has made the left but is still in the vicinit the intersection.]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bewildered, Corey tries to step out into the street but something blocks her -- an invisible FORCE FIELD makes forward progress impossible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RIPPLES swell like waves throughout the barrier where she it. She looks up, following the ripples with her eyes, an watches as they disappear beyond her realm of vision, int infinite space.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She reaches forth with her hand, wanting to feel the barr once again... Just as she touches it... REAL TIME RESUMES

dialogues.speaker: FROM OUT OF NOWHERE AN OLD JALOPY SAILS RIGHT IN FRONT
dialogues.text: RANDY'S CAR! He jerks the wheel -- and the JALOPY hits on front passenger side -- completely smashing it in --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam spins when she HEARS the deafening CRUNCH...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy careens into the opposite lane, and an ONCOMING CAR smacks him dead on. The inertia from the oncoming vehicle plows his car into a FIRE HYDRANT by the side of the road

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hydrant goes flying through the air like a bullet --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The world goes SILENT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corey signs her STATEMENT on Officer O'Dell's desk, the expression of shock still glued to her face. O'Dell sits facing her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're sure you didn't see a driver?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes the statement from her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you're one lucky girl to have gotten outta the car when you did. Front passenger side was wiped right out. Coulda' been two dead girls today instead of one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corey nods, taking this in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I talked to Randy and sent him home a little while ago. He's pretty shook up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corey doesn't respond. O'Dell leans in to speak to her in confidence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Both of us know he'd been doin' some drinkin' today. But we also know he's not at fault here. That old beater cut right in front him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't you just look up the license plates?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No plates on the vehicle. We're investigating the VIN, but that could take a little more time, depending on the history of ownership. We'll find him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corey seems somewhat hesitant to bring up the next subjec

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about the missing boy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Dell shifts in his chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You really think it was him, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was on the side of the road right before the accident.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm no psychiatrist, but I do know sometimes shock does funny things...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think I was hallucinating?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We were on the scene five minutes after the accident. I think somebody woulda noticed a little boy wandering around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sees how troubled Corey is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you stop in and see Dr. Peters on your way out... right down the hall there. She'll give you somethin' to make you feel better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corey nods and gets up to leave. As she's on her way out, O'Dell's voice stops her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, uh... is there anything you wanted to say to Samantha's parents?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corey's expression is blank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corey walks out of the police station and finds herself i secluded back parking lot. She holds a PRESCRIPTION for a depressants.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She is frightened when she notices a PAIR OF EYES staring her from the bushes close by -- it's Vietnam Tom. He's wearing his ski mask and he's got his rifle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corey backs away as Tom slowly creeps toward her... She's about to scream for help when Chris Holt comes out of the police station behind her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get the hell outta here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grateful for his presence, Corey moves to stand behind Ch Tom shuffles away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Should know better than to be carrying his rifle around town like that...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corey takes a breath, recovering from her scare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What're you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had to put in a statement too. Can I give you a lift?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris and Corey pull up to the motel in his pick-up. They gotten Corey's prescription filled, and she has the BOTTL PILLS in her hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm real sorry about Sam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corey nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's such a waste. Just a horrible, freak thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said some pretty shitty things to her right before it happened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sure she knew you didn't mean it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corey gets out of the car and walks toward the motel room

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corey swallows two of her PILLS with some liquor from a plastic cup. She sits down on one of the full-size beds w Sam's belongings are spread out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She opens Sam's backpack and discovers THE PHILOSOPHY OF TRAVEL book, by Roberta Sparrow...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Corey studies the cover, her image is reflected by the CLOSET DOOR MIRRORS. The angle of the mirrors creates dou image reflections for other objects in the room. Strangel Corey's reflection is only present in one of the panes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The digital CLOCK/RADIO shows 6:30 PM...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are PICTURES of Sam's family tucked away inside the book, between the pages: Sam with her mother and father, and EDDIE DARKO; YOUNG SAM with ELIZABETH and DONNIE; an photo of the whole Darko family together -- Young Sam hol ARIEL, a STUFFED TOY UNICORN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corey removes the pictures and sets them on the nightstan She then looks down and notices that the book is open to: CHAPTER THREE - THE FRAGMENTARY UNIVERSE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fragmentary Universe...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She pours over the text, some of which reads: When the fa of the fourth dimension within a Tangent Universe becomes corrupted, a highly unstable and volatile Fragmentary Universe can occur, sustaining itself for no longer than several days... FADE TO BLACK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corey awakens to the sound of a little boy CRYING. She si up in bed. The clock/radio reads 3:30 AM. The CRYING is f but steady and sorrowful, and sounds as though it's comin from outside...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corey follows the distinctive CRYING toward the VENDING MACHINES on the side of the building...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...until Billy Moorcroft emerges from behind them. Corey freezes a few feet away from the boy, who wears the BIRTH HAT, SLACKS and COLLARED SHIRT. He is pale and bruised.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corey sees that he is not crying -- it's coming from elsewhere in the cosmos, far away. The WAILS taper off to faint, DISTORTED WHISPER as Billy speaks:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You need to save me, Corey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corey stares at him in disbelief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You need to save me... and save the world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why can't anyone see you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you tell them about me they'll think you're a dummy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't pick you. Just like you didn't pick me either.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corey stands before him in awe, transfixed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We shouldn't even be here. Nobody should...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corey takes notice of the vending machines behind him. Wh the prices should be, NUMBERS flash in a rhythm that seem coincide with the ululations of the distant CRYING: 2... 10... 16... 44... -end-... 2... 10... 16... 44... -end-..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't have much time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corey is about to respond when the sound of a DOOR OPENIN stops her. The FLASHING NUMBERS on the vending machines g back to normal PRICES, the CRYING SOUND CEASES, and Billy disappears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's goin' on out here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corey looks over and sees Phil dressed in nightclothes, having come out of a room near the lobby. She's dumbstruc

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing... I-I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go back to your room and get some sleep. You've had a tough day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phil goes back inside, leaving her alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corey wanders through the aisles of the department store, looking peaked and jittery. She comes upon Chris stocking some shelves near the back of the store.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey... how ya feelin'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not so good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is there anything I can do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need some cigarettes... and maybe some food. But I don't really have any money right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm off at 3:30. Meet me out behind the store.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corey waits on the cement steps by the loading dock. She shoots up when Chris comes out the back entrance with a PLASTIC BAG...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corey takes it from him and looks inside: CANDY BARS, a B OF CHIPS, some PEANUTS, a pack of CIGARETTES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She tears open the cigarettes and lights one. Chris light one of his own, and notices Corey's hands are shaking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shouldn't you go back home?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's nothing for me to go home to. Trust me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about Sam's funeral?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corey looks conflicted, but she takes a harsh stance:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the point? She's gone, that's it. Nothing's gonna change that...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris lets it go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is there a library around here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (PUZZLED) Yeah... you need a book?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it walking distance?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can take you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I'd rather walk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corey and Chris stroll together along a quiet street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you guys were real close, huh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I moved to Virginia Sam was like the only person I could even stand to talk to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long had you been plannin' your trip together?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not too long... kind of a last minute thing. It was good timing, `cause I don't like to stay in one place for too long, ya know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was really surprised when Sam wanted to come, actually. I just kinda brought it up one day, and she was down...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corey reflects for a beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If it wasn't for me, she'd still be alive right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't think like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's true, isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris doesn't respond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corey and Chris sit before a screen in a cramped, dim boo near the back of the library. They stare at a MICROFILM ARTICLE from 1988 about DONNIE DARKO'S DEATH.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was Sam's brother?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the screen is a PHOTOGRAPH of the DARKO HOUSE with man PEOPLE gathered in front of it. A JET ENGINE is being lif away by a CRANE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her parents must be going through hell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam said once she wished it landed on her room instead of Donnie's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris thinks on this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw something on Sam's wrist the other night... it looked like a scar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She told me it was from some accident. Put her hand through a window or something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you believe her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corey doesn't answer. She pulls up ANOTHER ARTICLE, one t chronicles a MAN who was IMPALED BY A METAL PIPE with no known origin...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A THIRD ARTICLE is about a LITTLE GIRL who was DECAPITATE A MANHOLE COVER that was inexplicably flying through the air...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris is horrified. Corey is totally engrossed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She brings up a FINAL ARTICLE that tells the story of a B who was CRUSHED BY A DUMPSTER that fell from the sky. A PICTURE shows his legs sticking out from under it like th Wicked Witch of the East when Dorothy's house fell on her Munchkinland.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't understand why we're lookin' at this stuff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They still never found a driver to that car that hit Randy... I was standing right there. I didn't see anyone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was pretty close too, but everything was all crazy. Whoever it was must've jumped out and took off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I found this book in Sam's backpack last night. There's a chapter where it talks about stuff like this happening. Like a guy being killed by an arrow that nobody shot, and a swordsmith getting killed by a sword he hadn't made yet. Unexplainable things, but it says there's a reason why they happen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A book...? I don't get what your talkin' about. What was the reason?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It didn't say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corey thinks, trying to figure out the right way to expre something...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Last night, and right before the accident, I saw...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corey sighs and turns back to the screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You already think I'm a freak show.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Chris and Corey are on the way out, they notice Jeremy Frame at the counter checking out a STACK OF BOOKS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In putting them down, he accidentally drops half of them the floor. He looks frazzled as he begins to pick them up and he scratches compulsively at his LEFT FOREARM...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris and Corey pull up to Dusty's auto repair shop in Ch truck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They get out and start to walk up to the garage, but they cut off by the unchained PIT BULL -- it's growling and barking in a frenzy --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darielle!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dog heels at the sound of the voice, and Ruth bolts o of the house and takes her by the collar. She's got a ban over a cut on her forehead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come to check on your car?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hearts still thumping in their chests, they follow Ruth i the garage... COREY'S CHEVROLET is parked in the same spo was when she left it the other day. The hood is propped o

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy's been a wreck since the accident.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He should be. He was driving around shit-faced and somebody got killed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can just fuck off...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gets right up in his face with such intensity that Ch retreats a step or two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Prima donna motherfucker think your shit don't stink?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corey steps in:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's right...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris gives her a look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean, there's nothing Randy could've done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ruth turns and goes into the house through a GARAGE ENTRA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll get my dad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door slams shut behind her, and Corey and Chris glanc each other...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Momentarily, Dusty comes out, a partially eaten SANDWICH hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got some bad news for you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He walks them over to the car, finishing off his sandwich wiping his hands on his greasy jeans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your engine seized up when your water pump blew.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need a new engine now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can get one in there for you. Cost you about fifteen hundred.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corey's face drops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't have anywhere near that much money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's probably as much as the car's worth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I understand. But, I already ordered the water pump, and I'll have to get paid for my time. That comes to about three-hundred total.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't have that much either.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dusty is perturbed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think I do this for charity?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't do anything. What's she want a water pump for if she doesn't have an engine?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see how it is... couple a' punks. You don't plan to pay what you owe, you can get the hell off my property right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corey glares at him, furious, but Chris takes her by the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (under her breath) Asshole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris' truck pulls up in front of the motel and parks. At same time, Father Homeijer and Trudy come out of the FRON OFFICE carrying a COLLECTIONS JAR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they approach the truck Chris slowly rolls down the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good afternoon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're taking collections to help rebuild Mount Calvary after the tragic fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any small amount you could manage would really help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Father Homeijer and Trudy look over to Corey in the passe seat but she just stares back at them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God bless you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They turn and walk away, and Chris rolls his window back

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everybody wants somethin'...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wouldn't give me stuff and drive me around if you didn't want something in return.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: `Cause that's just not how it works.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe you're wrong about that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corey nods, but still doesn't believe him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See ya.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gets out, and Chris eyes her as she walks to her room

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corey lays on her stomach in bed, her head buried in The Philosophy of Time Travel book. The TELEVISION is on in t b.g. (out of focus), playing a repeat of the FOREMAN GRIL INFOMERCIAL...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, there is a slight TREMOR from outside and RIPPL runs over the TV screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
