dialogues.text: Corey looks around, taking no notice of the odd change on television -- instead of GEORGE FOREMAN'S VOICE, HULK HOG is HEARD promoting the brand new HULKSTER GRILL...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just then, there is a KNOCK at the door. She gets up to answer it and finds Randy -- he looks distraught.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you hate me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think it's my fault she's dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah... it wasn't your fault.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy sighs as if a big weight has been lifted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corey looks down and realizes that she's still holding Th Philosophy of Time Travel book in her hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, it's just... something of Sam's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy nods. Corey tosses the book onto the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wanna get outta here for a while? I got my dad's car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RANDY'S DAD'S CAR navigates a DIRT ROAD up a WOODED HILL VANTAGE POINT where the whole of El Reno can be seen. SPA LIGHTS flicker over about 80 square miles of civilization

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are a few OTHER VEHICLES parked at the lookout, mos containing COUPLES with MUSIC playing low.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy pulls into a more SECLUDED CLEARING, away from the other cars but still with a nice view.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been comin' up here since I was a kid. Good place when you wanna just get away from everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy pushes in a TAPE (suggestion: River of Deceit, by M Season), then takes a JOINT from his pocket and sparks it

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is Ruth your girlfriend?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy passes the joint to Corey and she hits it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Naw, we're just friends. She's pretty weird sometimes. Too like... intense, or something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seems like you guys are pretty close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah... don't worry about Ruth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy takes another hit and holds it in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you ever have a hard time telling what's real and what's not real?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy exhales and looks over at her, perplexed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sometimes... sometimes something can feel really real, but it's just your mind playing tricks on you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got so much shit in my head right now... I've never felt so outta control. I think I'm really goin' psycho.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He passes her the joint.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got some acid from my buddy one time... this like flying eagle pyramid shit. I took two hits, and man... next thing I knew I was on the floor, curled up in ball, and Mike and Jeff were just standing there lookin' down at me. I could see this like glowing grid cutting through my brain, and I knew when it got all the way through I'd be this sketched out vegetable. I could picture my dad staring down at me in the hospital in my straightjacket, crying and shit...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corey blows out a hit, captivated...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The whole time my esophagus was like twisting and turning in my throat and cutting off my air supply... it was terrible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can still slip back into it sometimes, but I know now that my brain is what's making it real... and that's like a blessing and a curse, man, `cause that means you have to decide what's real and what's not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The things that feel the most real right now are... impossible. More like a dream.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corey passes him the joint and he stamps out the roach in car's ashtray.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know what you mean. The scariest part is thinking you're not the same person anymore. Something's changed... like your identity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if the change is for the better?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy finds an INHALER in his pocket and takes a puff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's fucked up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think I even care if I'm crazy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corey turns and looks into his eyes. Randy leans forward. They're about to kiss, when --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A DARK SHAPE scurries to an enclosed area at the edge of forest where there's a TARP, some WATER BOTTLES, CANS OF and a RIFLE...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Vietnam Tom, and he's brought some supplies to his N SQUATTING GROUND.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That fucking guy again...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy and Corey both laugh, relieving the tension. But To proximity has spoiled the mood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's get outta here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike, Jeff and Ruth sit on a ratty couch in Randy's livin room, watching BEAVIS AND BUTT-HEAD on MTV. Some EMPTY BE CANS and a HOMEADE BONG litter a coffee table. When the F DOOR OPENS and Corey and Randy enter, none of them budge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Corey and Randy walk to Randy's bedroom, Ruth follows with her eyes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy shuts the door to his messy room. A TAPESTRY hangs the ceiling. Corey is drawn to a DESK next to the bed. Ab it is a DEATH SHRINE to KURT COBAIN -- MAGAZINE CUTOUTS, POSTERS and TICKET STUBS arranged decoratively.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A large BLACK & WHITE POSTER showing a CLOSE   UP of FACE is the centerpiece, and a sloppy BULLET   HOLE drawn RED MARKER marks the center of his forehead.   The words NOT AFRAID OF DYING' are scrawled across the   bottom of poster in the same BRIGHT RED.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is cool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy puts his hands on her hips, running them up her tor Corey turns to face him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They kiss...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and fall back onto the bed...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A DIGITAL CLOCK on Randy's DESK shows 3:30 AM. There's a SLIGHT TREMOR and the numbers shift, changing briefly to 01:10:23:08, then back again to 3:30.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corey wakes suddenly from a nightmare. She sits up and lo around, remembering where she is. She discovers Randy asl by her side. She finds a pile of clothes on the floor bes the bed and grabs her shirt...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...after she pulls it on over her head, she freezes -- because Billy Moorcroft is standing right there in his BIRTHDAY HAT, staring at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only one day left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corey turns and looks down to Randy. He's still fast asle

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What am I supposed to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As soon as she utters her question she notices a silvery, liquid VECTOR SPEAR protruding from the center of her che

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billy is now gone, but her SPEAR beckons her out of the r elongating to illustrate her path. Corey is in awe...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her SPEAR leads her through the living room, and past the sleeping bodies of Mike, Jeff and Ruth. Following her pat leads her to step on RUTH'S FOOT as she goes by...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corey doesn't even notice, but one of Ruth's eyes pop ope she treads out the door...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corey follows Billy, who walks in the middle of the road about 15 yards ahead of her. The residential street is guarded by great, OLD TREES on either side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dark sky above starts to BEND and WARP, and a BUCKLE space-time materializes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a simultaneous flash of LIGHTING and sharp CRACK THUNDER, and Corey looks up to the VORTEX -- a massive, swirling MAELSTROM gapes open like a tunnel to the inter- dimensional realm of darkest night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The VOID brightens, and ominous STORM CLOUDS and TORRENTI RAINS are visible within...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corey peers up into the MOUTH of it and sees DUSTY'S HOUS AND AUTO REPAIR SHOP being doused and beaten by the STORM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In contrast to the street, all is nearly SILENT in Dusty' garage. Corey watches as Billy moves along the perimeter WITHOUT SOUND, ghostly... JUMP CUTS and TIME CUTS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her CHEVROLET sits in the bay. Some of the PARTS have alr been harvested -- the CATALYTIC CONVERTER sits next to it the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corey approaches a UTILITY SINK next to a SHOWER in the corner...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's easy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corey focuses on the sink, and it begins to tremble. The pipes beneath it CREAK and MOAN. WATER starts to bubble u from the sink drain, also in the shower...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billy stands atop her car, watching her. His perpetually morose expression transforms into a smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SINK BASIN suddenly cracks from pressure. As Corey st into the drain... WE PLUNGE DOWN INTO THE PIPE --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We travel through meters and meters of DANK PIPING until hit the WATER MAIN. There's a sound like a TIDAL WAVE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- WATER POURS out from under the garage door down to the street. PULL BACK TO REVEAL --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The entire driveway and the street in front of the house covered with water. FIRE TRUCKS, POLICE CARS and an AMBUL are gathered in front of the property.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ruth runs toward her house. When she turns a corner and i comes into view, she stops dead in her tracks. Her face s sheer terror --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because her father Dusty is handcuffed and being loaded i the back of a cruiser by Officer O'Dell and another policeman, OFFICER HINES...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...the PIT BULL struggles against it's CHAIN, growling an barking frantically.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and Billy Moorcroft, half-naked, soaking wet and shivering, is wrapped in a blanket and being tended to by PARAMEDICS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucky I heard him screamin', else he woulda drowned down there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ruth keeps to the shadows and slinks toward a BACK DOOR..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She sloshes through four inches of water and skips up the stairs...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Without turning on the lights, Ruth desperately rifles through her closet until she finds a SHOEBOX.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inside it are several PLASTIC BAGS -- some filled with MARIJUANA, others with COCAINE...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hands shaking, Ruth dumps a bag of coke into the toilet a flushes it. The WHITE POWDER disappears down the swirling SPIRAL OF CLOUDY LIQUID...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But the bowl doesn't refill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She begins to stuff the other bags down her pants...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Having deposited Dusty in the back of the cruiser and shu the door, O'Dell's attention turns to an upstairs window the house when he sees MOVEMENT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy rolls over in bed, opening his eyes to the new day. looks around for Corey, disappointed to find her gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corey walks down an aisle of the department store. She fi Chris assisting a CUSTOMER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just checked aisle three.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're there. At the front, by the Trapper Keepers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Customer moves off and Chris turns to find Corey stan beside him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm outta cigarettes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corey waits behind the store until Chris comes out. She eagerly accepts TWO PACKS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: D'ya hear the news?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They found that Billy Moorcroft kid. He was at Dusty's house...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corey is floored.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sick bastard had him locked up in the basement. I can't believe we were just over there yesterday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corey can't help it... A grin spreads across her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess he's gonna be okay-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything's gonna be okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corey cuts him off, and Chris looks at her strangely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not crazy. I think everything's gonna be okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corey lays on her stomach in bed, studying The Philosophy Time Travel. The book is open to: CHAPTER SIX - THE LIVIN RECEIVER... The Living Receiver is chosen to guide the Artifact into position for its journey back to the Primar Universe. No one knows how or why a Receiver will be chosen...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She flips through the onion skin pages to: CHAPTER TEN - MANIPULATED DEAD... The Manipulated Dead are more powerfu than the Living Receiver. If a person dies within the Tan Dimension, they are able to contact the Living Receiver through the Fourth Dimensional Construct...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corey glances over at the CLOSET MIRROR and sees Billy's image reflected. She flips over and finds him standing at foot of the bed, clad in the same garb as all her visions

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I already saved you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He points to the CLOSET MIRROR... She stares into her own reflection as BILLY'S DISAPPEARS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HER IMAGE starts to FADE as well, and then the SURFACE OF MIRROR TRANSFORMS into a three-dimensional vision of a PA The focus is a SWING SET... and one of the SWINGS in particular, which rocks slowly back and forth. Empty. Voi life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inside Billy Moorcroft's quaint, sanitary-looking home is small gathering to celebrate his return. STREAMERS hang o a table supporting a partially eaten CAKE. A BANNER that reads `WELCOME HOME BILLY!' is draped across the archway connecting the DINING ROOM to the DEN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BILLY'S MOTHER (32), with her fair complexion and dark ha is an older female version of Billy himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As she brings a POT OF COFFEE and a STACK OF CUPS into BILLY'S FATHER (35), BILLY'S AUNT and UNCLE, and a CHILD PSYCHOLOGIST who is moderating (50s; male) in the den, sh looks as though she's barely keeping it together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (between bites of cake) The place for Billy to be right now is at home with his family...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billy's Mother interrupts as she sets the coffee down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Psychologist accepts a cup.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It'll take years for him to work through what happened, but the best way to open those doors is to surround him with things that are familiar...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billy's Mother passes her husband a cup, and they hold a long, painful moment of eye contact.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billy sits at a table in the sunny, HEXAGONAL ROOM. He we the BIRTHDAY HAT, SLACKS and COLLARED SHIRT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He appears clean and groomed, but his face and neck are marred by BRUISES and other ABRASIONS. Before him is a pa of COLORED PENCILS and some sheets of PAPER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His Mother walks up behind him, and peeks over his should at the DRAWING that he's working on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you sure you don't want some more cake?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billy nods. His mother caresses his head as she watches h color. After a moment she sits down in a chair beside him tries to get his attention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billy... I-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before she can go on, she's interrupted by the DOORBELL. Billy never looks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billy's Father answers the door and finds Corey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only family and close friends are welcome here today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billy's Mother hovers behind her husband, curious about a wary of the stranger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I understand... I just wanted to say that I'm sorry about everything that happened to Billy. And I know it doesn't seem like it, but everything happens for a reason... and it'll all work out in the end.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billy's Father stares her down until she turns to leave uncomfortably. Billy's Mother starts to cry... CUT BACK T

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...the breakfast nook. Billy is gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Left on the table is his completed DRAWING. It's a neatly executed rendition of a SWING SET -- identical to the one from Corey's vision in the closet door mirror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billy walks through the empty park, still wearing his birthday hat. He makes his way past a SAND PIT with a JUN GYM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Balanced on one of the jungle gym's bars is a PRESCRIPTIO BOTTLE...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billy picks it up. The name on the prescription is COREY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SWING SET. Billy leans back as far as he can as momen propels his body forward and back through space. He looks to the sky where SUPERNATURAL BLACK CLOUDS are forming...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He swings back and forth... back and forth...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corey sits nearby on a park bench, watching Billy. He loo back at her, showing no signs of recognition... JUMP CUT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SWING. No longer a little boy sitting in it. It dangl erratically from the ropes, still gripped by inertia...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PAN DOWN to the sandy ground below -- FIND the bottle of pills, now empty. Billy's unmoving, OPEN HAND...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A TRACTOR-TRAILER TRUCK gets off the highway and heads in El Reno. It's load is a batch of beat up, OLD CARS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The JALOPY is on the TOP RACK, CLOSEST TO THE END...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy peeks in the window of Corey's motel room but sees nothing. He pounds on the door and calls for her:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corey...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corey arrives near the intersection where the accident to place. The BLACK CLOUDS overhead have become more vast an oppressive. A cold WIND blows...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The TRACTOR-TRAILER TRUCK breaches the crest of a hill an comes into view, descending on the intersection.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Above it the CLOUDS begin to transform and take the shape an ASTRONOMICAL WORMHOLE that reaches down toward the earth...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris comes outside and gazes up at the foreboding sky...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the TRACTOR-TRAILER TRUCK approaches the intersection, Corey fixates on the JALOPY on the back...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CHAINS that hold the junker in place SHAKE and RATTLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We plunge through the PORTAL as it twists through the ether...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The WORMHOLE extends down to the JALOPY. Gracefully. Like eel moving through water, confidently pursuing it's prey. mouth widening to swallow...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corey is riveted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As it passes through the intersection, the TRACTOR-TRAILE hits a POTHOLE -- CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam is walking in front of the department store when Rand car pulls up beside her. Corey sticks her head out the passenger side window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened to you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened to me...? Where the hell've you been?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I crashed at Randy's. We just got food. Want a burger?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My stomach's fucked up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JEFF                               MIKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Awww...                           Poor tummy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff and Mike taunt her from the back. Ruth leers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We gotta talk about what we're gonna do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry about it so much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The motel guy came to the room this MORNING-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (INTERRUPTING) I don't give a fuck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said, I. Don't. Give. A. Fuck...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She annunciates every word like a true bitch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm tired of listening to you whine about everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Giggles from the peanut gallery in the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corey, you're still drunk. Don't be a fuck-ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did she just call her a fuck-ass?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's a fuck-ass?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone cracks up, including Corey. Sam is humiliated. S backs away from the car, anger burning in her eyes. Randy revs the engine, expressing his will to take off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See ya later, Sam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam says nothing, but watches as Randy's car peels off to the intersection. She's confused and hurt, frozen to the where she's standing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Corey stares back at Sam from the car, her smile fades

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corey turns to face the approaching intersection. Resolut

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris is at work, stocking shelves inside the department store...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He checks his watch, stops what he's doing and grabs a PA OF CIGARETTES from his breast pocket -- time for a smoke break.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy's car is stopped at the red light. Sam strolls towa it ever so slowly. Jeff, Mike and Ruth gawk at her from t backseat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She slows down even more, having no interest in subjectin herself to any more of their mockery...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The light turns green, and Randy's car peels across the intersection, making a left. Sam's still 10 or 15 feet aw from stepping into the street...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She quickens her pace, almost there when --

dialogues.speaker: FROM OUT OF NOWHERE AN OLD JALOPY SAILS RIGHT IN FRONT
dialogues.text: RANDY'S CAR! He jerks the wheel -- and the jalopy hits on front passenger side -- completely smashing it in --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam spins when she HEARS the deafening CRUNCH...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy careens into the opposite lane, and an ONCOMING CAR smacks him dead on. The inertia from the oncoming vehicle plows his car into a FIRE HYDRANT by the side of the road

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hydrant goes flying through the air like a bullet and skitters harmlessly across the intersection --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The world goes SILENT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam signs her STATEMENT on Officer O'Dell's desk, her eye red and puffy from crying. O'Dell sits facing her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just gotta ask you one more time... you're sure you didn't see a driver?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam shakes her head no, and he takes the statement from h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, we'll find him, one way or another.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam nods in acknowledgement. O'Dell sees how much this ha traumatized her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you stop in and see Dr. Peters on your way out... right down the hall there. She'll give you somethin' to make you feel better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam walks out of the police station and finds herself in secluded back parking lot. She holds a PRESCRIPTION for a depressants...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pair of eyes peek out of the bushes close by -- it's Vietnam Tom. He's wearing his ski mask and he's got his rifle. He sees Sam, but she doesn't see him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam wells up with emotion, about to breakdown, and Tom watches her with empathy. It looks as though he's about t to her when something stops him -- Chris comes out the do

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam is still too choked up to speak. Tom sneaks away unnoticed...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam sits in the passenger side of Chris' truck and cries cries. Major emotional release.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris looks like he wants to say something, but doesn't h the words.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris and Sam pull up to the motel in his pick-up. They'v gone to get her prescription filled, and Sam has the BOTT OF PILLS in her hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm really sorry, Sam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She doesn't respond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's horrible... but sometimes these things can happen for a reason. Sometimes good can come of it... growth, ya know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam's benumbed expression doesn't change, but her tone is caustic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All I meant was, sometimes-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know what you meant, and it's bullshit. When someone dies for no reason you can't just make one up to fill the void and make yourself feel better. It sucks, and it fucks everything up, but it doesn't mean shit beyond that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, I-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've obviously never lost anybody like I have, `cause if you did you'd already know that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris doesn't try anymore. Sam immediately feels bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks for the ride.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gets out of the car and slogs toward her room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam swallows her PILLS with some water, and sits down on of the full-size beds by her BACKPACK...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She reaches inside and pulls out THE PHILOSOPHY OF TIME TRAVEL book, by Roberta Sparrow. As she studies the cover her image is reflected by the CLOSET DOOR MIRRORS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The angle of the mirrors creates double image reflections other objects in the room... and Sam's reflection is pres in both of the panes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The digital CLOCK/RADIO shows 6:30 PM...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks at the PICTURES OF HER FAMILY tucked away insid the book: Sam with her mother and father; Sam as a child her sister and brother; an old photo of the whole Darko family together...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tears come to her eyes as she focuses on an image of Donn and she puts them all down. She touches the SCAR on the i part of her right wrist...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She then glances down and notices that the book is open t CHAPTER NINE - REMNANTS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remnants...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A portion of the text includes: Like Dreams that the Manipulated can have after journeys into Tangent or Fragmentary Universes, sounds and images may be transferr from one Tangent or Fragmentary Universe to another, as a corruptions exist on relative cosmic planes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam wanders through the junkyard clad in her HOODED SWEATSHIRT and JEANS, with the MAKESHIFT BANDAGE wrapped around her right hand. The SHARD OF METAL protrudes from GASH by her temple.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She sees the junkyard as the phosphorescent DESTINY PLANE DEAD CARS, MACHINERY and piles of SCRAP METAL glow as stationary objects within the complex grid. A PAIR OF RAT follow their VECTOR SPEARS as they shimmy up the side of RUSTY TRACTOR...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam treads effortlessly through the darkness, past the he of junk toward the decrepit STORAGE SHACK marked by the CORRUGATED ROOFING...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stands before the shack, having discovered Vietnam To He squats in the darkened corner of the scrappy shelter, looks back at her through the eyeholes of a new mask --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He wears on his face the SCULPTURE made of SCRAP METAL, w has been formed into the COUNTENANCE OF THE MONSTER BUNNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Tom. I like your new mask.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom trembles like the frightened animal he personifies as runs her fingers down one of the LONG, METALLIC EARS, dow one of the SHARPENED INCISORS of the EVIL-LOOKING GRIN...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you scared?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As this contact is made the tarnished metal becomes transparent, and the NEURONS in TOM'S BRAIN can be seen sending ELECTRIC IMPULSES, in turn RELEASING NEUROTRANSMITTERS and exciting OTHER NEURONS...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know you can hear me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A PORTAL forms around the shelter like a giant cylinder, enclosing them. Tom rises, afraid... Sam takes his hand..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The PORTAL shrinks and squeezes the walls until they bend inward, then begin to CREAK and RUMBLE --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam awakens to a fierce RUMBLING overhead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It happens again, and when she looks around she realizes she's underneath a highway overpass in BOXER SHORTS and a SHIRT, barefoot, lying on a FLAT AREA atop the CEMENT SLO that leads down to the road below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alarmed by both the height and sanitation of her current position, she shifts her body and starts to slide down th SLOPE...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Once on even ground, she notices a brand new `95 BMW comi toward her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perfect...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeremy pulls up next to her and rolls down his window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam? Are you okay? What are doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm... yeah, I'm okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeremy gets out of the car and puts his hand on her shoul

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You shouldn't be out here like this. C'mon, get in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She allows herself to be led to the passenger side...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam leans her head back against the headrest as Jeremy drives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You do that a lot?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think it's genetic or something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's interesting... I've never heard of a specific genetic marker for sleepwalking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just that my brother used to do it too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He doesn't anymore?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think it's more common in children. When did your brother stop?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When he died.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some WORKERS are in the process of   rebuilding the WINDM MAN WITH A HOSE sprays the side of   the WATER TANK in an attempt to wash off the burn marks   resembling the nearl imperceptible image of the MONSTER   BUNNY'S FACE...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeremy pulls into the motel parking lot. Sam hesitates fo moment before getting out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I heard about your friend...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam doesn't say anything, so he goes on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wasn't gonna say anything... but then I thought I probably should, because if I didn't, it might be inconsiderate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... okay. Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So... what are you gonna do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam brushes her mussed hair out of her face, still not wanting to go inside the motel room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you believe that everything happens for a reason?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know that for every action there's an equal and opposite reaction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah... I learned that in science.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And everything in the universe is in constant motion, as the universe is constantly expanding...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, but do you believe that everything happens for a reason, like in life?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean like destiny?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeremy thinks on this for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think everyone has a purpose. Something they're meant to do. Like potential, but more clear-cut. For instance, I was destined to get my hands on the meteorite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm making amazing discoveries every day, practically sleeping at the lab...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: While he talks and becomes more excited he scratches nervously at his left forearm. It draws Sam's attention a from what he's saying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm still doing some tests, but there's a metallic substance that's not showing up on the elemental CHARTS-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened to your arm?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeremy stops scratching. A small area on the inner part o his wrist is RAW and RED, partially SCABBED OVER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just a rash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam starts to get out of the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam, wait. Here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He offers her a wad of cash. Sam hesitates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BUT-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know you need it. It's no big deal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She accepts the money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam shoves a load of her wet clothes into an industrial DRYER. She plugs in some quarters, presses the button, an sits back in a chair in front of the machine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As she stares into the whirling cylinder, her eyes defocu and she goes into a daze... TRANSITION TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ARIEL, the STUFFED TOY UNICORN spins on a ROTATING CHAIR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Donnie!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (MOCKING) The Last Unicorn, by Samantha Darko!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give it back!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There was once a unicorn named Ariel...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SOUND of CRINKLING PAPER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Donnie! You wrinkled it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not wrinkled Sam. Just, ya know, flatten it in a book or something...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The chair is re-spun by an O.S. hand... and the UNICORN topples off onto the floor. BACK TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam snaps out of her vision when she hears Trudy and Fath Homeijer going around, asking for change.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any small amount you could manage would really help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They hover over a FAT MAN, holding out the COLLECTIONS JA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Piss off...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God bless you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they move down the line and approach Sam, she tenses u Trudy is about to go into her spiel when she recognizes h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh... hello.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She smiles at Sam politely, trying not to be too awkward. doesn't work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aware of Sam's financial situation, she gives Father Home the hint to move on. He follows her lead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Sam) God bless you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam watches as they move on to the next person, suddenly filled with sadness...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam stands outside at a payphone, listening to it RING... Someone on the other end finally picks up:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When Sam HEARS her MOTHER'S VOICE, it brings tears to her eyes. As if feeling her emotion over the phone line, Rose be HEARD starting to WHIMPER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Samantha?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in the background) Who is it, Rose?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (CRYING) Is that you?... if it's you, please come home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rose?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Although it looks like she wants to, Sam doesn't speak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vietnam Tom sits at his new squatting ground, looking out over all of El Reno. He peers at the twinkling lights thr his scrap metal BUNNY MASK, and cradles his RIFLE in his like a soldier at rest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He slowly turns and sees that Sam is sitting right next t him, facing the landscape. She wears her HOODED SWEATSHIR JEANS and the BANDAGE. The SHARD OF METAL is lodged in he forehead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wanna know what happens when you die?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom shakes his head no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish it was me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks at Tom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I really want... to die.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom aims his gun at her face...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He realizes that a FORCE FIELD has formed in between them because when the barrel of the gun touches it, the barrie bends and becomes slightly opaque.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam is expressionless. Tom's finger trembles as he places on the trigger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He aims down the gun's sights, directly at Sam's RIGHT EY and sees a PHOSPHORESCENT GRID take shape like a coordina system on the force field. Sam's eye is in the CENTRAL QUADRANT...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom pulls the trigger. TIME SLOWS DOWN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A liquid VECTOR SPEAR shoots out of the gun barrel. Immediately after, a BULLET is discharged and follows it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The VECTOR SPEAR passes cleanly through the grid, but whe the BULLET reaches it, the entire force field curves to accommodate the penetrating force...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The spear juts out until it nearly touches Sam's eye... b then it stops. The bullet catches up and freezes at the s spot, centimeters from her face --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (DISAPPOINTED) Not today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A HAND bangs on the door to room 15...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After a beat, Sam opens it. She's got some makeup on, and spent more time on her hair than usual.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris lingers in front of the door, looking slightly uncomfortable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just stopped by to see how you were holdin' up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry about the other night... I DIDN'T-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was just upset. I shouldn't have snapped at you like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris nods, grateful for her forgiveness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what are you still doin' here? I figured you woulda hopped on a bus by now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna be taking off soon, I think. I just gotta figure some stuff out. It's quiet here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know if you're doin' anything later on, but...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He trails off when he HEARS a CAR pull up and park by his truck. He turns and sees that it's Jeremy in his BMW.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was just on my way out. What were you gonna say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothin'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, well... I'll see you later?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He steps out of the way so Sam can shut and lock the door

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris stares down Jeremy as Sam gets into his car and the drive off together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeremy turns on the overhead florescent lights in the lab There are ROWS OF DESKS with MICROSCOPES and some PRECISI ROCK SLICING EQUIPMENT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he walks to a desk near the back, he can barely contai his excitement. Sam follows, taking note of a LARGE RABBI an extremely SMALL CAGE...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here's my station.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He unlocks a drawer in the lower portion of the desk and retrieves a BOX containing a tiny SLICE OF ROCK with a gr like PATTERN OF METALLIC CRYSTALS embedded in it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rest is locked away somewhere else... somewhere safe. Everyone's gonna want a piece of this thing pretty soon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes it over to an SCANNING ELECTRON MICROSCOPE and t it on. He places the meteorite slice in the microscope's VACUUM COLUMN through an AIRTIGHT DOOR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ever seen one of these?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a scanning electron microscope. It uses electrons instead of light to scan the image.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A BLACK & WHITE IMAGE appears on the microscope's MON it's a geometric collage of all shapes and shades.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At first I thought it was a siderite, but then I saw it was more than that. Much more. It does have a percentage of nickel and iron in it as I first suspected. But it also has something else.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He waits for Sam to take the bait.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He points to cluster of BRIGHT WHITES on the monitor. The shapes are strangely different than the others surroundin them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An unrecognizable element. I've done all the tests. It doesn't exist on the periodic table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeremy is practically beaming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So this is pretty major.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is history. I'm thinking of calling it framium.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Framium?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For my last name... Frame.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if it's like... proof of some alien life-form from another galaxy or something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeremy's tone becomes serious, and he starts to scratch a his left forearm as he talks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's very important you promise me you won't tell anyone else what I've showed you. I have to wait till just the right moment. NASA, or some secret government organization could come in here and take it away from me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Jeremy gets more worked up, he scratches harder...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then later on, years from now, take credit for the discovery themselves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I won't say anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam stares at him for a long beat, as if examining him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's this book I think you'd like... I got it from my physics teacher in high school.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The study of physics has unraveled some of the most profound mysteries of the universe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's called The Philosophy of Time Travel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Time travel?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, but it's not really that. It's more like one scenario, or one type of scenario. I don't completely understand it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam gazes at the cluster of white shapes on the monitor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another mystery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My life seems to be full of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mysteries are what make life interesting...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam doesn't agree or disagree. She's become tense, becaus Jeremy's face is now in close proximity to hers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a mystery to me, Samantha.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He goes in for a kiss, but Sam gently pushes him away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ow...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeremy retreats, shielding his left arm. Sam looks down a sees that the red, raw area has turned into a much bigger RASH, covering a large part of his wrist and extending on his forearm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That doesn't look good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I should get some Hydrocortisone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks pathetic, and Sam feels sorry for him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (regarding the attempted

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry about that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. I should've know better. You barely know me, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And nobody really calls my Samantha. Just my mom and dad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeremy manages a smile, and Sam smiles back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris is at work, stocking shelves inside the department store...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He checks his watch, stops what he's doing and grabs a PA OF CIGARETTES from his breast pocket -- time for a smoke break.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The TRACTOR-TRAILER TRUCK carrying the JALOPY breaches th crest of the hill, descending on the intersection...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris lights up a cigarette...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He watches as the TRACTOR-TRAILER hits the pothole, but passes safely through the intersection, making a right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something about the sight of this strikes Chris so much t his cigarette falls out of his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Father Homeijer and Trudy stroll down a quiet street with their COLLECTIONS JAR, and arrive at a fork in the road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You take this street, I'll take that one?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Without warning, Trudy kisses him on the cheek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good luck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Father Homeijer blushes, but Trudy smiles at him in a friendly manner. They move off in separate directions...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Father Homeijer raps on the door of Dusty's house. No ans

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The priest lets himself into the garage, which is open bu deserted. He notices COREY'S CHEVROLET. He steps up to th GARAGE ENTRANCE and knocks...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one comes to the door, but he notices that it's slight ajar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dusty?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He can hear COUNTRY MUSIC playing low within.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you home, son?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He lets himself inside...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Father Homeijer walks into the dingy kitchen. The SINK is full of DIRTY DISHES. A coating of GRIME over everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sleeping PIT BULL stirs...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The priest sees that the COUNTRY SONG is coming from a ST that sits on the kitchen counter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling out) Dusty? I'd like to trouble you for a small donation...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The COUNTRY SONG comes to a close, and the tape runs out. With the music gone, the priest cocks his head to a new s -- soft, distant CRYING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks curiously toward the CELLAR DOOR... [Note: The CRYING SOUND should be identical to the one that drew Cor out of the motel room.]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Father Homeijer slowly descends the rickety BASEMENT STEP At the bottom, he finds a STRING that connects to a bare overhead BULB...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He creeps along the dusty cement floor, past an old WASHER/DRYER, continuing toward the source of the CRYING, which has become more pronounced. He wrinkles his nose at foul smell...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He rounds a corner, and when he sees Billy Moorcroft he's nearly frozen in shock --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boy is locked inside a large, METAL DOG'S CAGE. He si on the floor of the cage, rocking back and forth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is pale, bruised and slick with sweat, clothed only in pair of SOILED BRIEFS. Beside him is an aluminum WATER BO and some scraps of WHITE BREAD. The floor beneath him is soaked with URINE and scattered FECES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Father Homeijer makes the sign of the cross.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dusty's place is surrounded by FIRE TRUCKS, POLICE CARS a an AMBULANCE. Billy Moorcroft is wrapped in a blanket and being tended to by PARAMEDICS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Father Homeijer stands near the boy, being interviewed by DETECTIVE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dusty is handcuffed and being loaded into the back of a cruiser by Officer O'Dell and another policeman, OFFICER HINES (28).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get in there, you sick fuck...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dusty says nothing as O'Dell shoves him in and slams the door...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two officers turn when they see RANDY'S DAD'S CAR pul next to the property. Randy is in the driver's seat, look confused. Ruth hops out of the passenger seat and darts toward the house --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- but she is cut off and grabbed by a POLICEMAN. ANOTHER OFFICER goes to talk to Randy in the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wheels turning, O'Dell addresses Hines:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (regarding Dusty) Let him rot in there for a few minutes, maybe till the news guys show up... I'm gonna go finish checkin' upstairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Dell lets himself into Ruth's bedroom. It's a mess -- h CLOTHES are all over the floor, and crinkled ROCK POSTERS litter the walls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Next to her bed is a FRAMED PICTURE of she and Randy. O'D starts to rifle through her desk drawers, one after anoth

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He tosses the closet, throwing out clothes and shoes... u he finds the SHOEBOX. He opens it up, satisfied...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Officer Hines stands by the door, looking in at O'Dell covertly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam lies in bed in front of the television. A NEWS BULLET comes on about Billy's Moorcroft's rescue:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have an update this morning on our breaking news of Billy Moorcroft, the El Reno youth who was kidnapped over 15 months ago, and rescued yesterday afternoon by Father Homeijer of Mount Calvary Church. Billy's condition at this time is considered stable...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam stares at the television, dumbfounded. The news cuts the scene of the rescue, where Father Homeijer is being

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Father, what led you to this particular house on this particular day?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was out collecting donations in order to help rebuild my church, Mount Calvary, which recently burned down. Clearly the Lord works in mysterious ways. This is nothing less than divine intervention...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Sam's walking away from the motel, she looks up to the at a PASSING JET...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No matter how well you think you know somebody, you just never really know...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam sits at the booth where she and Corey sat before, and Agatha sets down a glass of ORANGE JUICE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dusty Gibbens has been comin' in here for coffee ever since I can remember... gives me the shivers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted pipes up from behind the counter:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They should hang guys like that. Only thing bothers me is how many of `em are still out there...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris enters the diner and catches the end of Ted's rant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hang `em all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Sam) I'll be right back with your breakfast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Agatha moves off, Chris sees Sam and approaches her ta

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess you heard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's so messed up... I feel bad that I recommended him now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agatha notices that Chris has sat down with Sam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What can I get you, honey?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh... sausage, eggs, coffee, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: White or wheat?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wheat toast, please...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He refocuses his attention back on Sam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I had kids, I'd be worried sick about `em in a world like this. I'm sure your parents must be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, you could've been some crazy rapist serial killer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agatha is there with his coffee just in time to hear this last part. She gives Chris and Sam each an odd look befor setting the coffee down and leaving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You turned out okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, but everybody doesn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can take care of myself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sure you can... but I wouldn't feel right if I didn't tell you about Jeremy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what you have goin' with him... but you shouldn't be hangin' around him. Let's just leave it at that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What makes you think you can tell me who I can and can't hang around with?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just that I know him better than you do. He lived in my neighborhood when we were kids.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So he used to do weird stuff... to animals.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam waits for him to go on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My sister lost her pet rabbit once, and we went all over the neighborhood lookin' for it. We were just about to call it quits when we heard something comin' from Jeremy's garage. He'd stuck it in a trash can and put the lid on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam looks shocked and a little disgusted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was half starved by the time we got it home. Died just a few days later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How old was he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, just a couple years. Cute little black and white-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Jeremy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was like nine, probably.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was just a kid, he didn't know what he was doing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When you were nine years old did you know it was wrong to put a living creature in the trash can and leave it there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam's had enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris... you're a nice guy, but you don't have to be looking out for me. You're not my dad, you're not my big brother...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris hangs his head, frustrated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Dell stands at the bars of Dusty's jail cell. Dusty lie his cot and stares up at the ceiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what they do to faggot-ass perverts like you in maximum security, dontcha?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Dell chuckles, enjoying this immensely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Disgusting fuckin' piece a' shit like you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Dell, now dressed in plainclothes, is on the way to his in the far corner of the back lot. He HEARS someone come the door behind him, but doesn't turn until he HEARS his VOICE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, O'Dell...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm on my way out... what do you need?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hines catches up with him and they walk and talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not gonna bullshit ya.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw you snatch the drugs outta that house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Dell's face grows cold but he doesn't slow his pace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think I know what the hell you're talkin' about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't bullshit me either...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hines grabs his shoulder to stop him. O'Dell eyes his han

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't wanna turn you in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then what do you want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much you think you'll get when you unload it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Dell keeps cool, but resents being muscled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Depends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll take forty percent this time, but from now on it's fifty-fifty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean from now on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got a pretty good idea this ain't the first time you done this. Won't be the last, will it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hines extends his hand and smiles. O'Dell shakes it. Grudgingly...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After Hines turns on him and jogs back to the station hou O'Dell kicks the ground angrily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When he looks up, he's startled by a pair of eyes that pe from the bushes nearby. Upon closer inspection, he sees t it's Vietnam Tom in his SKI MASK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nervous about how much he's heard, O'Dell takes an aggres stance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on outta there. Now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He becomes tense when Tom emerges, because he sees that h got his RIFLE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck you doin' carryin' that around in the town proper?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Dell realizes that he's not holding it in a threatening manner, but cradling it in his arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hand it over. Right now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom steps toward him ever so slowly. O'Dell reaches out a Tom hands him the gun, stock first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I should arrest you and throw you in jail, you know that? Crazy sonofabitch...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom looks at the ground, hunched over meekly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get the fuck outta my sight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Dell looks around as Tom shuffles off, making sure no o witnessed the transaction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam trudges up the wooded hill to the vantage point, carr The Philosophy of Time Travel book. It's quiet and peacef and everything's bathed in golden light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She comes upon Tom's new squatting ground in a secluded a near the lookout, and looks around before approaching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When she sees the handmade BUNNY MASK lying among his thi she puts the book under her arm and reaches down to pick up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She runs her fingers down the long, shiny ears, nose, and jagged teeth...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She doesn't realize that Tom is standing close behind her When she senses his presence she's startled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She sets the BUNNY MASK down where she found it. Tom says nothing. He seems neither surprised nor irritated to find there. He walks up beside her and sits, facing the view.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After a long beat, Sam sits down beside him. To her surpr Tom begins to speak:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My mom told me someday everybody would understand. She said it was my job to look out for the town... so that's what I do. That's what I always do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam listens to him intently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They don't know why. They don't even want me here, but I still have to protect them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're lucky to have someone to protect them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm used to it... I'm lucky to have a job to do. Some people don't have any reason to be here at all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know what you mean...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom turns and looks at her strangely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're more important than all of us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam peers into Tom's pale blue eyes through his ski mask. Without knowing why, she reaches out and touches the mask

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When she starts to pull it off Tom grabs her hand, stoppi her -- not too rough, but forceful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam's scared for a moment, but Tom lets her go. His eyes drift down to The Philosophy of Time Travel book by her s Sam sees him staring, so she picks it up and hands it to

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When Tom sees the cover, his cold eyes are filled with emotion. Sam sees how struck he is, but doesn't understan

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you like to read?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom says nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can borrow it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Again, Tom does not speak. After a beat, Sam gets up slow and walks away, leaving Tom with the book.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeremy is at the department store in the FIRST AID SECTIO picking out some GAUZE and DISINFECTANT. When he looks do the aisle and sees Sam, he moves toward her quickly...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He disturbs her while she's looking at some FEMININE HYGI PRODUCTS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When he sees the items that she's shopping for, he seems more embarrassed than she does.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, hi Jeremy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi... sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's okay, what's up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing... just that I haven't see you around for the past few days. I was worried. I thought you might've taken off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... I've been around. Going for lots of walks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I stopped by the motel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam finds his manner a bit odd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like I said, I've been in and out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, there's something I wanted to ask you. You know that book you mentioned?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd really love to check it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam's face darkens, and Jeremy picks up on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said you'd show it to me sometime, and I've got a hunch it could really help me in some of my studies related to-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't have it anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I kind of... gave it to someone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To who? Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. I just... forgot that I said you could borrow it, and this GUY-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What guy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... that Vietnam Tom guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeremy is furious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vietnam Tom!? You gave away the book to Vietnam Tom!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam backs away from him. He's getting louder and out of control.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't fucking believe what you're telling me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just a book...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's a fucking bum! And you chose him over me!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... I just-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, a hand comes down on Jeremy's shoulder. He turn and finds Chris standing behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam is relieved. Jeremy glares at Chris.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is none of your business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is, actually. You're disturbing my customers. Get out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeremy brushes past Sam as he leaves, and she and Chris a left alone. There's a definite "I told you so" aura.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (MUTTERING) You didn't have to do that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just doin' my job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam starts to walk away, at first forgetting the products needed. She comes back to get them, slightly flustered. C turns and leaves her in peace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as he's walking away) You're welcome.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Father Homeijer and Trudy are sitting on the couch in the living room of his quaint house, sharing a BOTTLE OF CHAMPAGNE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never had any doubts in you, or in the Lord.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know that. And we both truly appreciate all your faith and hard work...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They sip their champagne. Trudy glows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We needed a miracle, but we got two instead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trudy grabs the bottle and tries to refill his glass, but priest puts his hand over it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I've had enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One more glass won't hurt you. You deserve it, Father...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'DELL'S CAR pulls up to an old warehouse and parks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where the hell are they?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hines is nervous. He lights a cigarette.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They'll be here. Just take it easy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom wears his metal BUNNY MASK. Sam wears her HOODED SWEATSHIRT and JEANS, and her right hand is BANDAGED. The METAL SHARD is embedded under the skin of her forehead...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They move slowly and methodically until they reach the ce of the empty lot. There are lights on in the closed department store, but the parking lot is mostly dark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do you talk to me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TOM'S VOICE is MUFFLED behind his mask.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Same reason you talk to me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom cocks his head, unsure of the answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because I can see how special you are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why can't other people?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They will. Only one day left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They both turn toward an area in the lot where the SHOPPI CARTS are stored. The METAL STORAGE RACK starts to trembl and burn with COSMIC ENERGY...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Father Homeijer finishes his glass of champagne. Trudy is already done with hers, and she takes his glass and sets on the coffee table. She moves closer to him on the couch

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trudy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She puts her hand on his leg.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see the way you look at me, Father...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She moves in closer... He looks uncomfortable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want you too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's about to kiss him, but Father Homeijer stops her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't do this. I'm a man of the cloth... and you'd regret it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes her by the hand, reminding her of the WEDDING BA on her finger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHOPPING CARTS start to roll out of the RACK by themselve following their own liquid VECTOR SPEARS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom stands staring at them. He is flanked by Sam...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Officer Hines walks to the edge of the woods beside the warehouse and unzips his pants...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With GLOVED HANDS, O'Dell grabs VIETNAM TOM'S RIFLE out o the trunk...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trudy's head is buried in her hands and she bawls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I feel like such an idiot...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Father Homeijer doesn't know what to say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hines finishes relieving himself and comes out into the o from the side of the building. O'Dell is waiting for him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Dell shoots him in the chest. He is cool and calm. He throws the rifle down on the ground...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SHOPPING CARTS whirl in an circle of ever-increasing speed around Vietnam Tom and Sam. The RUBBER WHEELS squea the cement until they start to melt...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The VECTOR SPEARS lead the carts in a spiral that hones i closer and closer to the two of them. Sam is stoic. Tom i awe...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We travel at breath-taking speed through a PORTAL as it weaves through millions of STARS, then an ATMOSPHERIC BARRIER...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When it looks like they'll be crushed by the scudding met or combusted by the cosmic energy, the WORM-LIKE PORTAL f the sky reaches down and encloses Tom and Sam like a vacu

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a brilliant FLASH OF LIGHT -- TRANSITION TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS' TRUCK pulls into the lot early in the morning, and gets out wearing his work uniform. Still groggy, he's abo to walk into the store when something catches his eye...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CRANE UP to FIND a STRUCTURE made of all the SHOPPING CAR as chilling and impressive as a crop circle, in the shape an immense FIBONACCI SPIRAL. The metal of the carts has b fused together, and they're stacked in an ascending manne that reaches an apex in the center, like a cone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris is mystified... CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two POLICE CRUISERS speed down a street in town...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COPS, including Officer O'Dell, converge on Vietnam Tom i the park, where he sits on the SWING in his ski mask...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get down on the ground!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom looks up at them calmly, without fear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get down on the ground, now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He obeys them and two Cops jump on him and put him in cuf One of them pulls up his head and rips off his ski mask -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
