dialogues.text: Tom's face is a mass of SCARS. Both his cheeks, forehead chin are marred by scar tissue born from long, deep gashe

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Dell looks into his sad, blue eyes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom is slammed against a table. An OFFICER takes his hand roughly and sticks his fingers into some ink to take his prints -- JUMP CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom stands for his booking photos -- JUMP CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (getting angry) What's your name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The POLICEMAN stands over Vietnam Tom, who sits defeated chair. A YOUNG OFFICER approaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We found this on him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He passes the Policeman a set of DOG TAGS on a CHAIN. The name on the tags is: THOMAS WARD SPARROW.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam walks toward the motel, wearing JEANS and a T-SHIRT..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When she sees JEREMY'S BMW parked in the lot she stops sh But it's too late -- he's already seen her and is getting of the car. He's got a bouquet of FLOWERS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Sam...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He passes her the flowers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope you can forgive the way I acted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was pretty weird.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. I just...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeremy is awkward and shy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been so wrapped up with the meteorite. I haven't been eating or sleeping much. I think I'm just drained... but that's no excuse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's alright.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was wondering if you'd let me make it up to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't need to-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please... let me take you to watch the fireworks tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's gonna be spectacular. There's gonna be a meteor shower that coincides with the show... I mean, how often does that happen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam still isn't sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just wanna be your friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was supposed to see `em with Chris, but... he's stuck at work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, what do you say? Will you go with me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gimme a sec. Lemme grab my sweatshirt...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeremy beams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris is in the department store parking lot with a crew EMPLOYEES. They work together to pry apart the numerous SHOPPING CARTS with CROWBARS. They've made some progress, still a long way to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris is distracted by JEREMY'S BMW as it cruises through nearby intersection...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After it passes, Chris looks up at some OMINOUS CLOUDS congregating in the darkening sky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From the CLOUDS above the store -- PAN DOWN TO FIND:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lookout, and Jeremy's car riding up the hill. There a OTHER CARS parked to watch the upcoming display, but Jere drives to a more SECLUDED AREA... (Music suggestion: 4th July, by Soundgarden.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeremy spreads a blanket on the ground of a private grove wears a LIGHT JACKET, and sets down a GROCERY BAG. Sam ha her HOODED SWEATSHIRT tied around her waist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shouldn't we go back out there where we can see?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, this'll be perfect. See right there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He points to an area near the tops of the trees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right where the fireworks'll come up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And we can see the meteors better without all the lights from the town.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam sits down on the blanket and checks her watch. Jeremy pokes around in the grocery bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what's in the bag?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll see...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam takes her HOODED SWEATSHIRT from around her waist and puts it on to fight the cold...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's one!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam spots a METEOR as it streaks across the sky --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JEREMY'S HAND holds a flaring ROMAN CANDLE --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here it goes!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SPARKLING GREEN BALL shoots out of the stick into the a Sam looks up at it and smiles. Jeremy shoots off colorful ball after ball, aiming in different directions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're pretty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After his stick fizzles out:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wanna try one?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam shrugs... He grabs another out of the grocery bag, an Sam gets up slowly. He passes her the ROMAN CANDLE, and s accepts it with her RIGHT HAND...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just hold it straight up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam holds it and Jeremy flicks his LIGHTER. The WICK catches...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's goin'!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam smiles and holds the stick as far away from her face possible. She closes her eyes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But the wick burns down extremely fast. The FIRST BALL ge stuck at the top and implodes, causing the whole thing to catch fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ow!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drop it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He runs over and stamps it out as quickly as he can...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fucking faulty one...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam nurses her burned hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think so...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeremy inspects her hand -- there's a large BLISTER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You need to get that covered...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeremy takes off his jacket. He then removes his T-shirt starts to tear off a piece.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bank sign shows 8:59 PM. The display flashes to: JULY 1995... It changes to the countdown: 00 DAYS, 00 HOURS, 0 MINUTES, 03 SECONDS... 02 SECONDS... 01 SECONDS...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeremy finishes wrapping the piece of his T-shirt around Sam's hand, creating the MAKESHIFT BANDAGE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's it feel?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A little better...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The FIREWORKS suddenly begin, and fill the sky above the grove with bursts of bright, multi-colored lights. Sporad METEORS rain down at the same time. It's magnificent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After a beat, Sam looks over at Jeremy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fireworks illuminate his torso, and she is appalled t see that the raw, reddish RASH has spread to cover the greater part of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good God...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeremy looks down as if he'd forgotten, then quickly pick his jacket and puts it back on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ALARMED) Is that from the meteorite?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I barely even notice it anymore. I'm sure it'll go away soon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He zips up his jacket tight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you fucking kidding me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you think I'm disgusting?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The question takes Sam by surprise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... I just think you should get it looked at-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before Sam can finish, Jeremy crams his mouth into hers f forceful kiss...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam shoves him away sharply.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you do find me disgusting. Which is it, Sam, I can't take much more of this shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He tries to grab her, but Sam turns and runs --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam tears through the woods, Jeremy close behind her. The FIREWORKS CRACK and POP in the sky above...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam! Stop!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam jumps over a fallen log in the dark... Jeremy hits it dead on with his shins and goes head over heels --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FUCK!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He picks himself up and charges even faster --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom sits alone in his jail cell, morose, staring at the floor. He looks up when he senses someone approaching...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam sprints by the area of Vietnam Tom's squatting ground FIREWORKS continue to EXPLODE and shower overhead, and so PEOPLE can be HEARD LAUGHING and SHOUTING from the main parking area, not far away...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam runs toward the VOICES --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Jeremy grabs her from behind and spins her around!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you doing this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just wanna talk to you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She struggles against his grip. The EXPLOSIONS and the RU from CROWD mask their noise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam raises her knee and connects hard with his groin. He starts to double over, but recovers quickly and smacks he across the face --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fucking bitch!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam is stunned, and Jeremy takes her by the shoulders and shoves her hard --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam stumbles backwards and falls, cracking her head on th metal BUNNY MASK. She rolls over onto her back, REVEALING SHARD OF METAL that protrudes from the GASH by her temple

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She struggles no more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom stands in his cell to meet the entity that approaches

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris and the other Employees stop working and look up at sky, now roiling with sinister, SUPERNATURAL CLOUDS...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeremy slowly creeps to where Sam lies... Her eyes are op and she is completely still.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam?...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeremy crouches beside her, and when he puts two fingers her neck to feel for a pulse, he starts to tremble...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The raining METEORS and FIREWORKS illuminate the SMOKE an the BLACK CLOUDS overhead...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vietnam Tom walks up to the CELL BARS...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He comes face to face with Sam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stares back at him through the bars from the other si She wears her HOODED SWEATSHIRT and the BANDAGE. Light gl off the METAL lodged in her HEAD WOUND.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeremy speeds frantically down the hill, away from the parking area and the continuing fireworks display. Tears stream down his cheeks...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He cuts the wheel when a pair of HEADLIGHTS blind him and vehicle cuts him off. His car skids out, and he sees it's CHRIS' TRUCK that has almost hit him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris jumps out, yanks open Jeremy's door and grabs him b the shirt collar. He yells over the FIREWORKS:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where the hell is Sam?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (FRANTIC) I don't know... I don't know...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeremy stomps on the gas pedal, and Chris is forced to un him as his BMW navigates around the truck and barrels dow the hill...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Chris approaches Vietnam Tom's squatting ground, the FIREWORKS DISPLAY is in the midst of the GRANDE FINALE. Showers of light BURST and CRACKLE in steady succession. PEOPLE SCREAM in approval from the parking area nearby...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris comes upon Sam's lifeless form.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stoops by her, picks her up and hugs her limp body close...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he does this, Vietnam Tom approaches from behind him. Chris turns to face him but says nothing, still holding S The WIND picks up and blows in gusts around them...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom looks down at the two of them for a moment, then reac down and picks up his BUNNY MASK. The EVIL GRIN is red wi SAM'S BLOOD, and one of the teeth is missing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The last of the fireworks display occurs, leaving the nig full of SMOKE, HELLISH CLOUDS and an increasing number of bright-tailed METEORS -- the APOCALYPSE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amongst the churning clouds, a tornado-like PORTAL cuts through the sky and touches down somewhere in the town. I swirling and vast, stretching down from limitless space..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 15 days... 18 hours...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom puts on the BUNNY MASK...

dialogues.speaker: SAM, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: 45 minutes... 6 seconds...      45 minutes... 6 seconds..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And focuses on a single METEOR that plummets toward the yawning VORTEX, using telekinetic power to guide it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The METEOR blazes through the WORMHOLE --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The clock on the BANK SIGN shows 3:30 AM -- then flashes JUNE 19, 1995... It changes again, this time to a countdo to the JULY 4TH FIREWORKS CELEBRATION: 15 DAYS, 17 HOURS, MINUTES, 57 SECONDS... 56 SECONDS... 55 SECONDS...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam awakens suddenly from a nightmare. She lies atop the blankets wearing a T-SHIRT and BOXER SHORTS. She looks ov and sees Corey passed out on the other full-size bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWO PLASTIC CUPS, EMPTY SODA CANS, and the BOTTLE are on nightstand between them, the liquor partially consumed. T CLOCK/RADIO reads 3:30 AM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vietnam Tom sits atop the platform, more than 30 feet up, wearing his ski mask and holding his rifle. The surface o the platform is littered with TATTERED CLOTHING, a WATER BOTTLE, CANS OF FOOD and SCRAPS OF A TARP.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Relaxed and at peace, Tom looks up to the clear night sky a TREMOR starts to build, he takes off his ski mask and g out over his town...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, there's a brilliant flash of GREEN LIGHT -- deafening THUNDER -- a blinding EXPLOSION -- CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dusty sits and stares at his CELLAR DOOR... Trudy holds a PICTURE OF FATHER HOMEIJER and cries... Ruth snorts some in her room... Jeremy scratches his LEFT FOREARM in his sleep... Billy Moorcroft shivers from the chill in his CAGE... Officer O'Dell sits alone in his patrol car, fingering the trigger of his PISTOL... TRANSITION TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where the towering windmill once stood is now only a CRAT about 5 feet deep and 10 feet in diameter, with charred b of wood and metal strewn everywhere. Ground water spurts the broken well seal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A cantaloupe-sized METEORITE sits in the center of the crater...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two FIREMEN haul out the meteorite as Sam and O'Dell arri on the scene. There are PARAMEDICS, a CORONER and other POLICEMEN there as well, and a large area has been cordon off with POLICE TAPE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corey is there looking on, as well as Chris Holt, Phil Coulter, and other local CITIZENS. TOM'S REMAINS are carr off in a BLACK BAG...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam moves to stand by Corey. The overall mood is grim, an Frank stands peering at the wreckage with a long face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't believe it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Firemen drop the porous, misshapen clod by his feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is just a tragedy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Officer O'Dell steps up beside him and kicks the meteorit with his boot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sell that thing off to some meteorologist nerd club, I bet you could do okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do I look like the type of guy that's gonna try and profit off another man's death? You should be ashamed of yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (EMBARRASSED) I was just sayin'...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam looks down on the ground and sees Tom's multi-colored MASK...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She picks it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As she caresses the fibers with her fingers, she is fille with unwarranted emotion...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam and Corey are on their way back to the motel room whe they turn and see that Chris has followed them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you guys stayed here last night?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of us did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam gives Corey a look. Chris decides to ignore the comme

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's up with your car?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's gonna take a couple days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For a water pump?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam and Corey shrug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's none of my business, but...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's distracted when JEREMY'S BMW pulls up and parks. He out and hustles across the field toward the crash site...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris regains his train of thought:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was just gonna say, if you wanted, I could give you a ride back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks right at Sam when he says this. He then glances at Corey, as if just remembering that she were there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You too. I mean, I could give you both a ride.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To Middlesex, Virginia? Do you-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (INTERRUPTING) I'll go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (PISSED) What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I wanna go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Things get a little tough, you're just gonna give up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not like that... You should come too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck that. I'll wait for my car and stick to the plan. Do whatever the fuck you want.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corey turns and goes inside the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corey...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam looks back to Chris, who is uncomfortable for causing conflict.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry to screw you guys up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's alright. She can take care of herself... she's good at it. I've gotta go home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The METEORITE sits in a dark corner of the barn, collecti dust...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam leans her head against the window of Chris' truck as cruise along the highway...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gazes up at the bright, open sky.
